fields.transit: We are 3.5 miles to the closest public transit, so if someone needs a ride from Aptos, I am willing to pick them up. There is parking for the cabin, a short walk down the driveway.
fields.street: Trout Gulch Rd, Aptos, CA 95003, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: Even though we live only a 7 minute drive to Aptos village and the beaches, it feels very remote and private here. It is usually very quiet at night - sometimes we can hear the ocean waves crashing on the beach. There is lots of land to hike on and explore here as well. We have a little community of artists, musicians, healers, construction workers - all enjoying the wonderful nature and shared living here.
fields.space: We have 10 acres next to land without fences so you will get to enjoy nature: just hang out on the deck, take a hike in the woods, watch the hummingbirds or go to the beach. To check our availability, click on the Calendar link above the cabin photo. And yes, if it isn't available, it is already booked! If you want to stay here on a weekend during the summer, you will need to make your reservation request about 5 - 6 months in advance. We do, however, occasionally get a cancellation, so if you want a date that's already booked, you can let us know and we will notify you of a cancellation. (Please read all of this description before making a reservation. The cozy and clean semi-rustic cabin has a loft under a geodesic dome (the "mushroom cap"). In the loft is a double bed, which is a cotton futon with 2" of latex foam and 21/2" gel memory foam on top. (It is now softer for you folks who like a soft cushiony bed.) We provide clean sheets and pillow casesl. Plenty of blankets are also pro

fields.host_about:
We live on 10 beautiful acres of sun, oak forest, redwood groves and gardens with a small  community made up of ourselves (Kitty and Michael), 1 of our adult sons, 8 other young adults, a Chiropractor, a plumber, and a retired mason, 3 goats, a parrot, 4 cats, 2 small dogs, 17 chickens and over 200 hummingbirds. 

Kitty teaches Universal White Time Gemstone Healing, is a healer, artist, builder, farmer and musician. 
Michael works at the University of California, Santa Cruz Extension in Silicon Valley, managing the International Education program. He bikes, runs, swims, sometimes all in the same day. Together, Kitty and Michael teach Meditation classes with the "Teaching of Intuitional Metaphysics" under the guidance of the Masters Babaji, Jesus, and St. Germain.

The young adults here are photographers, surfers, artists and/or musicians and budding farmers.
We are slowly turning this land into a permaculture farm and a center of creativity, learning to live simply, with joy and kindness.
 
We hold a public non-denominational meditation at our house every Sunday night: you are welcome to join us if you are here.

We have been hosting on airbnb since July, 2009 and really love what this company has made possible. We have met so many wonderful people from around the world that we would never have met if we hadn't had this opportunity with airbnb! Some of our guests (especially the ones from Europe) have never seen a hummingbird before and here they get to see them up close - just a few feet from them as the birds "hum" around the feeders.

We welcome you to come experience the peace and tranquility that our wonderful land has to offer.
fields.name: Mushroom Dome Cabin: #1 on airbnb
Cottage with courtyard! Private! 5 mins to Dwntown
fields.notes: Check in is anytime after 4PM. Check out is by 11 AM. If you need in earlier, let me know.  Please text me at checkout so i can let the maid know. She likes to start as early as possible.
fields.summary: Gorgeous private Cottage with everything  you need to enjoy a few days in Nashville! But the best part - Only mins to downtown! 8 mins by car
fields.neighborhood_overview: Wow...Lots of new homes being built and older homes being renovated on this street!
fields.space: Cottage Suite! •Private entrance with off street parking •Full bath with 4'x3' Shower •Queen size bed •Wet bar with Mini fridge, Microwave, Keurig Coffee maker!, (stocked with coffee, breakfast items, popcorn, bottled water) •Flat Panel TV with cable •Now with Fiber Optics Internet!!      Come and go as you please. Beautiful new 300 Sq.Ft. cottage located behind my home is just minutes to downtown Nashville, Bicentennial Mall, Farmers Market, and Germantown restaurants. Public transportation bus stop just down the street. I am a General Contractor and have built my home and 2 others in this super convenient up and coming historical neighborhood.   PLEASE NOTE - HOLIDAYS AND WEEKENDS ARE 2 NIGHT MINIMUM
fields.access: You will have your own parking space behind the cottage on a concrete pad off the alley and you have your own private patio!
fields.interaction: I'm on the main house, give me a shout if you need anything!!
fields.transit: If you don't have a car I suggest downloading the LYFT or Uber application to your smartphone. This is definitely the best and cheapest way to get around the city by auto. It's about a $7 ride to the downtown entertainment district! Or you could walk (app 15 mins) to the Farmers Market and Bicentennial Mall State Park area. There you can rent bikes or catch the free downtown bus loop (Music City Circuit) that runs from 6 am till 6 pm at 7th and Harrison.

fields.host_about:
I know your not coming to Nashville to visit me, but i will do my best to provide a great place to stay while you are in Nashville! I am a single Dad with 2 great kids off to college! I built this home 3 years ago and love living near downtown Nashville. I am an avid walker and most weeks put in 15 to 20 miles just walking from my home to the Historical Germantown area, Bicentennial Mall State Park, Farmers Market, State Capital, Legislative Plaza, TPAC, then on to Lower Broad, 2nd Ave, and Riverfront park where all the honky tonks are located! That total distance is just a little over 2 miles each way. 

     I was in the USAF and Tennessee Air Guard for 13 years where i was a navigator on C-130's. After my military life i became a General Contractor and started my own business. After being in the country for so long i decided to try the city life. I bought a vacant lot in this historical overlay district and loved it. Since then I have built 2 more homes on this street. I do love this up and coming neighborhood. 

     I also love to hike the mountains! I have summed 3 12,000 foot peaks in the Rockies and last summer my son and I summed 14,254 foot Long's Peak in Rocky Mountain National Park. I must admit - it kicked my ass ... but wow!... what a view!  Leaves no doubt there is a God!  I also love to kayak and travel. But the best times are with the kids. We love to play strategy board games..Settlers of Catan, Acquire, and Cashflow. I love Axis and Allies, but its hard to get them to play that! I also play in a Texas holdem Poker League...for points...not for cash!

UPDATE:  That's my first grandbaby...Walt....Born 19 November 2012!!

fields.space: Perched on a hilltop with a magnificent 360 degree vista of the Pacific Ocean, Catalina, Santa Barbara Island and the Santa Monica Mountains, spend the evening watching the sunset over Boney Mountain as it fades to black. The stars come out by the millions- and you watch for comets and satellites passing overhead from the comfy Adirondack chairs. You retire to the comfortable semi-restored interior of 'THE ALUMILODGE'- a 1957 AIRSTREAM 22 ft. FLYING CLOUD, and plug your iPod into the Bose Acoustimas sound system while opening a chilled bottle of local area wine you acquired on a vineyard tour. The dinette is set for a romantic dinner which you prepare in the onboard galley and gas stove. After another look at the Milky Way, you retire to the Queen size rear bed with quality linens and feather duvet- the fresh Pacific breeze lulling you to sleep in the silence broken only by the occasional owl 'hoot' or coyote howl in the distance. You awake to experience the sunrise with our French cof
fields.access: 40 acres of our private property plus access to public hiking/ biking trails right from the trailer. Swimming Pool (seasonal).

fields.host_about:
My wife and I are Christian, semi-retired film industry people who thrive on adventure and meeting interesting people. Over the past 15 years I've restored several vintage Airstream trailers and consider them the ultimate in camping comfort. One of my restorations now actually resides in Japan! 
We used to love to travel and camp in our 1957 'FLYING CLOUD' AIRSTREAM but now enjoy allowing others to share the experience without the hassle of driving, towing and fighting for a spot in a crowded and noisy campground. We live on a 40+ acre ranch property (with some overly friendly dogs and horses) in the Santa Monica Mountains- surrounded by thousands of acres of open space and direct access to the famous Backbone Trail, which is renowned for hiking, horseback and mountain bike riding. We are also only 6 miles from the glorious beaches of Malibu. Our hilltop location is the perfect deluxe camping experience, with ocean views, and base to enjoy this unique mountain range and Mediterranean climate which occurs in only 6 places in the world.
fields.interaction: As little, or as much contact with guests as desired. Your privacy and security is strongly respected.
fields.name: AIRSTREAM VINTAGE TRAILER ADVENTURE
fields.summary: A unique experience for the person who loves nature and vintage American icons. A little rustic, but vastly rewarding. Please read the entire listing and view an extensive photo library to determine if this venue meets your creature comfort quotient.
fields.house_rules: CAMPFIRES ARE NOT PERMITTED BY LAW DUE TO HIGH RISK OF WILDFIRES. SMOKING IS ALSO NOT PERMITTED.  UNREGISTERED GUESTS or friends are not permitted to visit or 'hang out' with guests on the property without prior approval from hosts. Unfortunately we are not insured for unregistered guests. The short access road to the site may not be negotiable by certain vehicles, especially in winter months, in which case we will provide transportation to and from your vehicle securely parked on the property. Actual interior dimension of the trailer is 19ft. long x 7ft. wide.  Galley is equipped with stove,oven,frig, sink, hot & cold water and all utensils for cooking.The bathroom includes a toilet and small shower.  Good restaurants nearby (seasonal hours). Warm clothing is advised even in summer as we are at the 1650 ft. elevation and evening temperatures are cool. Have a good charge on your phone/ iPod as trailer system does not support 110V chargers. Suggested ap: "Nightsky" for star gazing.
fields.notes: Nearest supplies are 6.5 miles away so SHOP PRIOR TO ARRIVAL.  From 101 Fwy. : Between 1st and 2nd traffic light on Westlake Blvd. (Hwy. 23 S.) there is a Gelson's, Sprouts, Vons & CVS Pharmacy. Trader Joe's is across the fwy.  left on Thousand Oaks Blvd. From PCH (Hwy. 1) : Vintage Grocers 30745 PCH at Trancas Canyon approx. 4 miles east of Decker Cyn. (23 S.)

fields.name: Walk to Everything Downtown- 2BR
fields.notes: This probably isn't the place to host a party. Our building appreciates quiet hours after 9pm (Su-Th) and 10pm (F-Sa). We require that you remove shoes inside. Many reasons for this. Especially high heels. Thank you!
fields.summary: Consider this your home away from home. This is a cozy, convenient space set up to relax while also having many things to do outside and nearby. The loft is on the second floor, so it's quiet. It is very central to everything Denver has to offer. Put away your car keys and explore this awesome little nook of Denver.
fields.neighborhood_overview: This loft is at the edge of Denver, and one of the hottest zip codes in the country. We are close to dozens of dining options; from an award winning cocktail bar to a ramen shop. We've got classy French cuisine and beverages, and we've got a kid-friendly pizza restaurant. Nearby are breweries, wine bars, tapas and rooftop views. In town for sports event? Nearby: Broncos stadium, Coors Field for Rockies games, and the Pepsi events center are all super close.
fields.space: This condo is a 2 bedroom, 1 bathroom space. Inside, there are 3 memory foam queen beds. One bedroom has a queen bed, a room divider, and a queen bed on the other side. The second bedroom has a comfy Healthcare memory foam queen bed. Both bedrooms are private to the shared space. There is also an L-shaped sectional in the living room which is a comfortable place to sleep as well! Please note that there is NOT a gym in the building. Rather, it is a block away. There is a drop-in fee, but we've had guests who get a free 3-day pass, too. Check out LoHi Athletic Club for details.
fields.access: You get a code when you reserve, and the code is typically the last 4 numbers of the phone number that you provide to Airbnb site.
fields.interaction: I'm always available by text/voice, and we welcome your questions!
fields.transit: Streets are busy and safe to walk in the evening. Bike paths are plentiful and you could tour the whole city on the bike path hub a few blocks away. There is a bike station two blocks away that features rentals called b-cycle. The 16th Street Mall is at the center of Denver and the free mall ride will take you up and down the 1.5 mile stretch of shops and restaurants. There are also Smart cars distributed throughout the neighborhood that can be easily rented from the website Car2go. If you have a car and want to head to the mountains, the foothills are just 15-20 minutes away, and the large ski resorts are approximately 1.25-2 hours away. Looking for a cabin to stay near Grand Lake? We highly recommend our friend's cabin: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/15431596 Airport Shuttles will bring you here for about $40 one way if you negotiate before you get in. There is a convenient train from Denver International Airport that is $11 and will bring you to Union Station (1.25 miles away.) The Li

"One of the best ways to make yourself happy is to make other people happy; one of the best ways to make other people happy is to be happy yourself."
fields.house_rules: Please respect quiet times after 9PM on weekdays and 10PM on Weekends.  No candles, insence, smoking of any tobacco or non-tobacco products. Including vaping or e-cigarettes.

fields.notes: Most people choose to walk instead of getting public cards as our place is located in city central. Renting bikes is also an option for a real Amsterdam experience.
fields.summary: Situated in the Jordaan, the coolest, hippest place in Amsterdam. Treat yourself to a self catering private guest quarters with: free coffee/tea, and a big comfy bed. Comfortable for 2 adults (and possibly up to max 2 more on another pull out bed).
fields.neighborhood_overview: The Elandsgracht is a well known street and area in the Jordaan. There are many great restaurants, and shops on our street. Once you walk over the bridge from the Prinsengracht, you enter the nine streets, one of the most popular shopping areas in the City.  The Anne Frank House is just a 5 minute walk from our place.
fields.space: Located in the heart of the Jordaan, in city central Amsterdam. Our backroom, formally the guest quarters of an artist atelier, is on the ground floor, access to a garden, fully private and all main attractions, cafe's / restaurants, and shopping are within a walking distance. Our neighborhood rocks! There is always something going on. Festivals, concerts, and everyday shopping on the nine's streets, dining or getting a drink in the many bars and restaurants.  You have a private, "Amsterdam style" ensuite bathroom (shower, toilet), a great real bed, a microwave / oven, fridge / freezer, a Nespresso machine,  and a great skylight. The studio apartment can sleep up to 2 adults comfortably, and up to max 2 more on a pull our day bed.  If you are coming with 4 people, we ask for a 2 night minimum stay. It's just too much laundry for 1 night.  The garden area is great to use on a nice day and the room has these amazing glass ceilings which bring in a lot of natural light.  As a guest, you w
fields.access: The main house is not part of the rented space, but feel free to chat if you find us there. You will have access to the guest quarters, garden space, use of bbq if desired (please ask), free wifi.
fields.interaction: We try to be available as much as is needed. The back room is accessible by walking through our ground floor, so it is likely we will have contact, which we like. If you like to get some tips or tricks, please feel free to ask.
fields.transit: Public transportation is down the street: Trams 7, 10 and 17, bus 170, 172, not to mention the Marnixstraat bus station is on the corner, and bus 197 is the direct bus to and from Schipol Airport, which takes about 35 minutes and only  €5 (beats a taxi).

fields.host_about:
I am a wife, mother and social entrepreneur living in Amsterdam. I am an American and have lived here for about 9 years. Spare time is something treasured as we are both self employed and find ourselves constantly in need to finish work that is never done. 

We love spending time with family and friends, seeing and experiencing new places and meeting new people. Reading and running, nature and fresh air are things that breathe life into me. Why do I live in a city? Good question. Amsterdam is charming and we have all grown to love it.
fields.house_rules: The backroom is located off our garden and is only accessible by going through our house. We would like guests to be considerate of this. You will be given a key so you can let yourselves in and out. No one sleeps on the ground floor, so you don't need to worry about disturbing anyone.  We are a family and we ask that the backroom be used with this in mind. We do not allow loud parties or drugs on our property.  Please don't smoke inside the Backroom. Feel free to smoke (cigarettes) in the yard area.

fields.transit: We offer Airport pick-up for $15 each way. (cab fare from our home ranges from $27-$36). Please make airport pick-up arrangements with us in advance.  We offer bike rentals with helmets for $18 per day. There are bike paths that can get you to any part of the city from our Grant Park location. We have 4 bikes of varying sizes, which are all in perfect working order.  We are right on the TriMet 77 & 70 Bus lines and a 15 minute walk to the Hollywood Light Rail Station.  There are usually several Zip Cars throughout the neighborhood.  Click on the Guidebook at the top of the page to see everything you can walk to in the neighborhood.  We are looking forward to hosting you!
fields.street: Grant Park, Portland, OR 97212, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: The suite overlooks beautiful Grant Park, with outdoor swimming pool, tennis courts, play ground, walking paths and quarter mile track.  There is a 24 hour QFC Supermarket just blocks away, and Whole Foods, Trader Joe's and New Seasons Market are all within minutes.  There are many restaurants, bistros, bars and eateries within walking distance, including Shandong (Chinese), Sweet Basil (Thai), Nicholas (Lebanese), Cha Cha Cha (Mexican), Hale Pele (Tiki), and Pour Wine Bar & Bistro (Small Plates).  Grant Park is situated in the middle of the outstanding NE neighborhoods of Irvington, Alameda, Beaumont, Hollywood and Laurelhurst. Alberta Arts, Oregon Convention Center and Downtown Portland are all just minutes away.  Grant Park has a 98% walkability score.

fields.host_about:
I'm a web designer, Internet entrepreneur, business consultant and guitar player. I work from home, so I'm usually here to guide and serve. I love to cook, play music, and spend time with my daughter. I'm an East Coaster originally, and spent most of my earlier days in Maine, Boston and New York City. I'm enjoying watching Portland grow into an international city while refining it's amazing food, tech and geek culture. 

I look forward to meeting you, and showing you a fun and memorable stay in the Funky Pad.
fields.interaction: I'm usually here if guests need me, and enjoy getting to know our guests. But I also offer complete privacy when that is preferred.
fields.name: Funky Pad Suite - Parkside Portland
fields.summary: Bright, private studio-suite in beautiful Grant Park home. Excellent central location. 650 sq ft of private space. Queen-bed in main suite. Double-bed in adjoining dormer bedroom. Optional extra twin bed in the main suite to accommodate a fifth guest. Private, modern bathroom, bar, kitchenette, dinette and reading area.
fields.house_rules: Check-in is anytime between 3pm and 11:30pm. If you need to arrive after 11:30pm it's not a problem. Just let me know as soon as you are able. You're always welcome to come by early to drop off your bags. I can let you know if the suite is ready before 3pm upon request.    Guests can have visitors to the suite, as long as they are known friends or family. All non-paying guests should depart between 10:30pm & 9am unless otherwise approved by us. There is an 8 person capacity limit in the suite at all times. No smoking please. Smoking outside is OK. You are welcome to relax in our backyard.  We allow pets upon approval, as long as they are housebroken and well behaved. Guests agree to be financially responsible for any damage caused by their little friends. We charge an additional cleaning-fee of $12 for pets because we've found post-pet cleanup to be more involved. This fee means you don't have to board your pet, and allows us to provide a hair and dander-free environment for every gues

There you can rent bikes or catch the free downtown bus loop (Music City Circuit) that runs from 6 am till 6 pm at 7th and Harrison. But just do as i do and walk...only about 25 mins to the downtown entertainment district!!

fields.host_about:
I know your not coming to Nashville to visit me, but i will do my best to provide a great place to stay while you are in Nashville! I am a single Dad with 2 great kids off to college! I built this home 3 years ago and love living near downtown Nashville. I am an avid walker and most weeks put in 15 to 20 miles just walking from my home to the Historical Germantown area, Bicentennial Mall State Park, Farmers Market, State Capital, Legislative Plaza, TPAC, then on to Lower Broad, 2nd Ave, and Riverfront park where all the honky tonks are located! That total distance is just a little over 2 miles each way. 

     I was in the USAF and Tennessee Air Guard for 13 years where i was a navigator on C-130's. After my military life i became a General Contractor and started my own business. After being in the country for so long i decided to try the city life. I bought a vacant lot in this historical overlay district and loved it. Since then I have built 2 more homes on this street. I do love this up and coming neighborhood. 

     I also love to hike the mountains! I have summed 3 12,000 foot peaks in the Rockies and last summer my son and I summed 14,254 foot Long's Peak in Rocky Mountain National Park. I must admit - it kicked my ass ... but wow!... what a view!  Leaves no doubt there is a God!  I also love to kayak and travel. But the best times are with the kids. We love to play strategy board games..Settlers of Catan, Acquire, and Cashflow. I love Axis and Allies, but its hard to get them to play that! I also play in a Texas holdem Poker League...for points...not for cash!

UPDATE:  That's my first grandbaby...Walt....Born 19 November 2012!!

fields.summary: ADULTS ONLY   NOT FAMILY FRIENDLY Registration #(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) NO children or grandchildren of any age under 18 years old are allowed on the property at any time. Includes infants,  NO KIDS of any age!  The Garden Cabana is a special gem nestled in an unbelievable succulent garden! You will have complete privacy and be able to enjoy your deck by yourselves. Please come and stay in this resort-like setting while you enjoy your time in San Francisco.
fields.neighborhood_overview: Excellent location for getting around town while staying in a wine country atmosphere, or hang out close by and enjoy some of the finest restaurants and cafes in San Francisco. No kidding!
fields.space: ADULTS ONLY  Welcome Dear Guests! I look forward to meeting each of you. My listings are for ADULTS ONLY over 18 years old: NO EXCEPTIONS whatsoever so please don't even ask. My listings are NOT family friendly.  My property was designed with the quiet and mature adult in mind, the guest who is looking for a respite in the City, for a place to catch up on much needed sleep and restoration between days spent working, visiting relatives, or exploring San Francisco. Many of my guests arrive with jet lag, so please- no kids (no infants/ toddlers/ children or teenagers) under 18 years old and no pets. My architecture office is on the property and I live in the main house so I will be here to help you as you get acquainted with San Francisco.  Thank you for helping to insure a quiet environment for all of us.  I look forward to sharing my home and garden. Cabana details: Super cozy-- great heater for winter/ ceiling fan for summer. Private deck for Cabana guests only.  One double bed, Europe
fields.access: Guests may use the shared garden and the shared laundry room.  NO KIDS allowed anywhere on my property! Please read the House Rules.
fields.interaction: I'll see you to say hi and maybe we'll enjoy a glass of wine or cup of tea together in the garden!
fields.transit: Choice of easy access to buses and the trolley. The trolley goes to downtown and Market Street, the buses are great for heading over to the Mission and other neighborhoods. Easy walking to great restaurants and cafes. Super fast Uber and Lyft pickups, first time users can use my code for free rides: Uber: 0ZW76 (that's a zero at the beginning) Lyft: KEPA495343

fields.host_about:
Hi Guests,
Thank you for considering staying with me during your visit to San Francisco. Whether you're coming for business, pleasure, or to visit family, I think you will enjoy my rooms and my neighborhood. 
I've been here in San Francisco and in Potrero Hill since 1978, and I can help you figure out what to do and how to get around. I've had construction and design businesses all my life and I'm enjoying adding Airbnb hosting to my daily routine. I've travelled quite a bit and enjoy having the world come to me!
Here are all of my listings:
Potrero Hill Garden Cabana: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/205842
Potrero Hill Garden Suite: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/33577
Potrero Hill Garden Lookout:https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/33578
Potrero Hill Garden Getaway: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/918341
Please email me if you have any questions. I hope to hear from you. 
Kepa Askenasy

fields.name: Bright Venice Loft, Steps to Beach!
fields.notes: Pet-free, feather-free, non-smoking, very clean.
fields.summary: Unbeatable location! Just two blocks to the beach, between Venice Beach and the trendy shops/restaurants on Abbot Kinney. Private, bright, airy loft with high ceilings, hardwood floors & skylight. On the top floor of a small, two-level building.
fields.street: Venice, Los Angeles, CA 90291, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: There’s so much to do within walking distance! Abbot Kinney shops/restaurants (some of the best in the city!), the beach, bike path, famous Venice Beach boardwalk and Venice Canals. Main Street Santa Monica shops, the Santa Monica Pier and 3rd Street Promenade are all close by and easily accessible by car, bus, or bicycle.  Malibu, Westwood, Century City, Beverly Hills and Hollywood are just 20-35 minutes away. The location is within a 15-20 minute drive from LAX and can also be reached by public transportation from the airport.
fields.space: **the loft has been recently updated & improved** The loft has automated entry so no need to hassle with key exchange and check-in anytime after 3pm. The space includes wood floors, sofa, workspace and a new electronically operated skylight.   LOFTED SLEEPING AREA - A few steps up the ladder awaits a brand new queen-sized Casper mattress for ultra-comfort and relaxation. - Four pillows, fresh linens and warm blanket - Plenty of hanging space and hangers - Flat screen, cable TV The KITCHENETTE  - New, easy-to-use coffeemaker with high-quality coffee - Microwave & toaster - Dishes, silverware and other basic kitchen supplies - Dish soap, sponge, paper towels BATHROOM - Shower with excellent water pressure, new shower head, and unlimited hot water  - Shampoo and body wash - Fresh towels - Hairdryer - Excellent lighting and a window ADDITIONAL AMENITIES - Iron with ironing board - Space heater and fan - Beach umbrella, beach towel OTHER INFO There’s no assigned parking, however, street par
fields.access: I have bikes on site available for rent.  You can drop your luggage early and leave it after you checkout if needed. Just ask for details :)
fields.interaction: The checkin procedure is automated so you don't need to worry about late arrivals or having to wait for me at the property.  I live very close so I'm around to answer any questions you might have during your stay.
fields.transit: You can reach many local attractions by walking or on bike. If you wish to explore other parts of the city, I recommend Uber. Use code ij487 in the payment section for a free ride.

Yoga teacher, design enthusiast  and world traveler born and raised in Los Angeles!

I'm extremely organized, dependable and detail-oriented so rest assured I'll make sure you stay goes well. I love managing my vacation rentals in Venice and love sharing the unique, beachy vibe I create in each place. I'll be easily reachable throughout your stay should something arise.

I love being active...yoga, pilates, or hiking daily is a must! I have traveled to over forty countries, and can't wait for my next adventure. My favorites are India, Syria and Thailand.

fields.neighborhood_overview: Potrero Hill is one of the last remaining neighborhoods with no chain stores- all of our restaurants are locally owned and many of the recipes have been handed down from the grandparents- French/ Italian/ Vietnamese/ and Peruvian and Mediterranean. A true gourmet ghetto is just out the door. We're also the sunniest area in SF- so bring layers to wear because the evenings can be cool and other areas can be cold!
fields.space: ADULTS ONLY   Hello Guests! The Garden Suite is a large studio style accommodation with a Private Entrance- you will be the only ones here! fields.access: Share the large resort-like courtyard garden and enjoy a cool beer or glass of wine amongst the succulent collection and large grassy back yard. Shared laundry room.
fields.interaction: I live in the main house and my architecture office is on the property so I am around to help you get settled and answer questions.
fields.transit: Easy bus access to downtown and all points of interest, and a short walk to the trolley to the Giants stadium/ Ferry Building/ Chinatown and North Beach. fields.host_about:
Hi Guests,
Thank you for considering staying with me during your visit to San Francisco. Whether you're coming for business, pleasure, or to visit family, I think you will enjoy my rooms and my neighborhood. 
I've been here in San Francisco and in Potrero Hill since 1978, and I can help you figure out what to do and how to get around. I've had construction and design businesses all my life and I'm enjoying adding Airbnb hosting to my daily routine. I've travelled quite a bit and enjoy having the world come to me!
Here are all of my listings:
Potrero Hill Garden Cabana: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/205842
Potrero Hill Garden Suite: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/33577
Potrero Hill Garden Lookout:https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/33578
Potrero Hill Garden Getaway: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/918341
Please email me if you have any questions. I hope to hear from you. 
Kepa Askenasy
fields.house_rules: PLEASE READ THE HOUSE RULES •No smoking on the property • No one on the premises under the age of 18 (no infants/ toddlers/ children  or teenagers- including with adult supervision) • Two adults maximum per listing • No partying- please respect that other guests may have jet lag and are sleeping or napping- or that I may be having clients over for business (my architecture office is in the back cottage). We all can get a little too loud with too much to drink so please don't drink too much! •Keep the street door locked at all times •No photo or video shoots or commercial use whatsoever- this is a residential property and my insurance could be voided if you do so (plus it’s inappropriate- this is my home). Personal photos are welcome. • No pets • No parking in my neighbors’ driveway even for a moment, please ask me to show you where to park: PARKING: If you plan on bringing a car (not necessary for touring the City) please tell me ahead of time so that I can explain to you where you can

fields.transit: The apartment is 400 metres from the Airport Bus Link service on Waverley Bridge and the Train Station is even closer.. no need for taxis!  Also the Tourist City Bus Tour buses stop directly outside the Apartment and tickets can be bought from the driver.
fields.neighbourhood_cleansed: Old Town, Princes Street and Leith Street
fields.neighborhood_overview: The Canongate is an area rich in culture and history in the heart of Edinburgh's Old Town, forming the lower part of the Royal Mile. The apartment is approx half way between Edinburgh Castle and  the Palace of Holyrood, the Scottish Parliament and Authur's Seat. Other nearby attractions are; •Grassmarket •Dynamic Earth •The Elephant House ( J K Rowling cafe) •Edinburgh Castle •Edinburgh Festival Theatre •Edinburgh University •Edinburgh Waverley Railway Station •National Gallery Of Scotland •National Museums Of Scotland •Palace Of Holyroodhouse, •Princes Street •Scott Monument •St Giles Cathedral
fields.space: Large comfortable private room in the heart of the City Center.  Actually on the Royal Mile, your bedroom faces South and overlooks the Historic Chessel's Court and is amazingly quiet at Night.  The apartment is split level and feels very spacious.   The Apartment is 400 metres from Waverley Train station and the Airport bus link.  Less than a 10 minutes walk to Princes Street and approximately half way down the Royal Mile between Edinburgh Castle and Holyrood Palace. Not forgetting the glorious Authur's Seat where in less than 15 minutes you can find yourself immersed in a mini Highland wilderness with Lochs and amazing views. Ideal for Festival goers as very close to all major venues. The Pleasance Courtyard is less than 5 minutes walk away. Seconds from many restaurants and bars and coffee houses. Very comfortable king size medium firm mattress, pure cotton bedding, 10.5 tog goose down duvet and powerful electric heating. Good quality pure cotton  towels are provided.   A hairdryer,
fields.access: Come and go as you wish, there is some great nightlife close by and coming home late is not a problem.  (Shoes off at night in the bedroom please). Make use of the shared kitchen with stove, kettle and toaster. The shared Bathroom has roomy power shower unit, bath and the luxury of underfloor heating. Breakfast.   Help yourself to whatever cereals teas and coffee I have.  Or there are many delicious places to get a Scottish cooked breakfast close by which i can personally recommend.  Check out the guidebook on my listing. Or feel free to use the cooking facilities and refrigerator.

fields.host_about: I enjoy all things to do with Art and Music.  I am interested in technology and interior spatial design.  I love travelling and hosting people from all over the world and my favourite destination in the world so far is in Cornwall, so far.
fields.name: Large Sunny Room on Royal Mile
fields.interaction: I'm out and about cycling depending on weather, and I know the city very well and am happy to suggest great places to explore, eat and drink.

fields.house_rules: Your room has a wooden floor so shoes off in your room at night-time please. If bringing large luggage must take care no not bang them against the stairs as this disturbs neighbours.
fields.notes: Unlimited free use of Netflix in the common area on 40 inch Sony with Apple TV and Chromecast. Edinburgh city center now has free unlimited wifi for all visitors.  All major attractions are within this range. Choose _EdiFreeWIFI from network list and fill out quick form to log in.

fields.name: Mission Sunshine, with Private Bath
fields.notes: Our home is 100 years old, and has creaky stairs and floors, and very little sound insulation. With neighbors directly above, right and left, you'll likely hear footsteps, dogs barking, babies crying, any manner of "city" and/or "roommate" noise. It's peaceful, and we try to stay reasonably quiet until guests awake, but if you seek complete tranquility, then our home might not be the right fit. That said, only about 1% of our hundreds of previous guests have mentioned noise as an issue.  We like to know a bit about our guests, so please complete your Airbnb Profile before attempting to book.  If you plan to arrive later than 10:00 PM, please let us know BEFORE booking. If you book first, and then tell us about your late arrival, we'll request a $50 Late Check In Fee.  Please check your total price before booking. Our pricing varies, and can be higher on weekends and during "high" season, and there's also a cleaning fee, and a sur-charge for a 3rd guest.  We do not offer discounts for l
fields.summary: Welcome to San Francisco's Mission District, the sunniest neighborhood in town!  Enjoy Valencia Street's world-class dining, shopping, and nightlife, or a picnic in Dolores Park on a sunny afternoon... It's all just steps from our 100 year old home!
fields.neighborhood_overview: Located between Valencia Street and Dolores Park, our home is in an ideal location for exploring the Mission, as well as the rest of San Francisco. It's an easy walk to the Castro, Haight Street, Hayes Valley, and Noe Valley. And we're close to BART and Muni, so it's easy to visit the Ferry Building, Union Square, Downtown... Everywhere!  Then again, you might not want to leave the neighborhood at all... Here's a very incomplete list of spots within 4 blocks of our home: Foodie Heaven: Tartine, Delfina, Bi Rite Market, Mission Chinese Food, Locanda, Foreign Cinema, BiRite Creamery, the list goes on - and seems to grow daily!  Shopping: 826 Valencia (Dave Eggers' Pirate Supply Store!), Paxton Gate, Curiosities for Kids, Beta Brand, Mission Bicycle, Self Edge, Weston Wear, Shoe Biz... Dolores Park, the Chapel (for live music), Clarion Alley (home to the CAMP Mural project), the Women's Building (maybe the most famous of the famous Mission Murals), Mission Pool (seasonal outdoor swimming,
fields.space: Your sunny room has a queen size bed, and looks out over lush gardens. It includes all the comforts of home... Sofa, dresser, closet space, rocking chair.  Your private (though not "en-suite") bathroom has a "like rain" shower head, over a clawfoot tub.  We have a twin mattress available for $60/night, to use for a 3rd Guest or for separate sleeping. (It can go on the floor in the same room, or in our dining room if you'd like a little more space.)
fields.access: Guests have their own bedroom and private bathroom (though it is not "en-suite") as well as shared access to our living room and sunporch. In the kitchen, guests can store food in our refrigerator, re-heat using the microwave, and make light "snacks," but you may not use the stove, pots and pans, or sharp knives. (Sorry for the extreme limits on using the kitchen, but we've had too many pans and knives ruined. And with all the world-class restaurants nearby, who wants to cook anyway?) Also, we occasionally host guests in another room in our home, so there may be other airbnb guests sharing the common spaces with you.
fields.interaction: We are experienced Airbnb hosts, and have had 100's of guests before you. We'll happily point you toward the traditional tourist sites or the hidden hotspots, whatever your preference.  Guest interaction covers the full range, from sharing dinner or drinks, to rarely seeing each other. It all depends on preferences and schedules.
fields.transit: It's an easy and lovely 10 minute stroll to the 16th St/Mission BART Station, and there are Muni Routes all around us, so there's easy access to SFO, Union Square, Moscone Center, Market Street, the Ferry Building, Golden Gate Park, AT&T Park... Everywhere!  Our neighborhood is great for bicycling: Flat, with dedicated bike lanes on both Valencia Street and 17th Street. And we're both avid riders, and love to share the city's cycling secrets. (Trust us: You want to know about the Wiggle before you set off to Golden Gate Park.)  The 101 and 280 freeways are also nearby, but parking in our neighborhood is tough. (There is a parking garage three blocks away, ~$20/day.)

fields.host_about:
Ivan is a publisher of a book for 4 year olds. (Look for "Four is a little, Four is a LOT" or "fourlosophy".) Wendy is an elementary school teacher. And Milo is a 25 pound mutt. (Terrier...? Chihuahua...? Pinscher...? Perhaps. Sweet...? Charming...? Adorable...? Absolutely!) 
We've hosted continuously since 2009 - the year Airbnb née "AirBedAndBreakfast" began! We love our home, our hometown, and our neighborhood, and we look forward to sharing them with you. We'll happily make dining recommendations, share insider sight-seeing ideas, and hopefully help you have a great visit.
fields.house_rules: SMOKING: No Smoking anywhere in, on, or around the property, or within 25 feet of the front gate. No Smoking in the Garden. No smoking on the front stairs.  QUIET HOURS: Quiet Hours are 10:30pm to 8:00am on weeknights, midnight to 10:00am on weekends. Those are not "lock out" hours, you may come and go as you like, but if you are home during Quiet Hours, please keep noise to a minimum: No late night showers, no audio without headphones, no sitting and talking in the garden, etc. (Our neighborhood is authentic "San Francisco" in its density and architecture, so there are neighbors very nearby, and sound travels surprisingly well in the still of the night, and through the lightwells between buildings.) CHECK-IN: Our check-in time is listed as "flexible" but think of it as "TBD" - To Be Determined.  After you book, get in touch and let us know what time you'll arrive, and we can coordinate check-in. We will try to accommodate your preferred arrival time, but no guarantees.  ARRIVAL: Once

fields.name: Comfortable  - and a great value!
fields.notes: PLEASE READ ABOUT DENVER LODGING TAX RIGHT HERE BELOW: Denver (and Colorado) now impose lodging tax on short-term rentals. It is 14.75% on shorter-than-30-day Airbnb reservations. Airbnb is now collecting and remitting the Colorado portion, 4%, but individual Denver hosts are responsible for collecting and remitting the Denver portion (10.75%). Different hosts are handling the collection differently, some by just increasing their prices to cover it, but in order to save you, the guest, money (by not having to pay the Airbnb fee and the Colorado tax on the portion added to cover the  Denver lodging tax) I will ask you (in a process I initiate) to remit it through the Airbnb resolutions process within 72 hours of having completed your reservation. The percentage will be figured on the amount of the reservation before Airbnb added their fee. When you contact me, please state that you understand you will have to pay 10.75% more (if your stay is for fewer than 30 days)  and that you agree t
fields.summary: Large guest room in my home, where I also live.  I have breakfast foods for you to help yourself to. If 3 people share this room, one sleeps on the couch in the room.
fields.neighborhood_overview: I love the diversity of my neighborhood and its proximity to shopping and restaurants.  I live on a beautiful parkway.
fields.space: I have been enjoying welcoming many wonderful guests into my home for over 8 years now with Airbnb (from 33 different countries so far.)  Please have a bit of info about yourself in your Airbnb profile. (Hover over the tiny picture of yourself in the very top, right corner and Edit Profile will be one of the options that pop up)  In this guest room there is a queen-sized bed, couch, wifi, TV for DVDs and VHS tapes only (I have a selection), (I may have TV working again soon. Ask if it's important to you) desk with computer you may use,  also some closet and drawer space.  Must share bathroom with me, (or use basement bath) but my time is now flexible since I retired!  There has never been an inconvenience yet with sharing the bathroom.   The room fits two people comfortably, but sometimes a third person sleeps on the couch, which they report is comfortable.     I, of course, provide clean towels, soaps, hair dryer, and will probably have on hand anything you might have forgotten.  You
fields.access: You may make yourselves at home in all public parts of house -- kitchen, living and dining rooms,  or relaxing outside on patio,  watching films downstairs, or listening to stereo.  You may use my washer and dryer if need be.
fields.interaction: I am happy to interact as much or as little as desired by guests.   I am busy and often go out in the evening.  I have lots of guest information collected in a large binder in the room.  I am happy to make recommendations, or take you with me if I'm going somewhere you'd enjoy.
fields.transit: The number 20 RTD bus is 2 blocks away to go downtown, or the other direction to the Anschutz Medical campus.   Easy transportation from the airport via RTD commuter rail, the University of Colorado A Line (nothing to do with the university - they just paid for the naming rights for the A Line)-$9 regular fare, $4.50 seniors (and some others who qualify for discounted fare, such as military I think)   From Central Park stop, take a 65 bus to right across from my house - the 26th and Monaco stop.  Or, I often am available and happy to pick you up from Central Park.  There is ample free street parking and also some space in my driveway.

fields.host_about:
I am friendly and I love meeting people from all over the world.   I have received guests from over 33 different countries so far, in over 8 years of being an Airbnb host.  I'm easy going and easy to get along with.  Staying with me can be like staying with a friend of a friend, in that I am glad to try to take care of your needs, and give you pointers about Denver, (or pick you up from the train from the airport - Central Park stop) or also happy to leave you alone and grant you all the privacy you want (tell me.)  I have no pets, but occasionally I dog sit for my grandpuppy.  I speak French well, some German and Spanish.  

As a traveler, I love to go places, stay a while, and interact with locals.  I love using Airbnb to travel and like to stay with hosts who also live in the property.  I enjoy just walking around, getting a feel for a city and meeting people,  more than just seeing the big tourist attractions.  I think I am adaptable and an easy and appreciative guest.   I love to speak French, practice my Spanish and even try to resurrect my long-forgotten German.  I always like to try to learn to say at least please and thank you in the language of any place I visit.
fields.house_rules: Please read about Denver Lodging Tax under "Other Things to Note" and by Instant booking, you are agreeing to pay the separate and additional 10.75% Lodging Tax.  I prefer non-smokers, but if you smoke, please do so quite away from the house outside.

fields.transit: We have FREE on street parking for those of you who wish to drive. There is regular and reliable public transport service to and from the city centre. The bus stop is right outside the flat and a variety of buses (11, 16, 22 and 10) run straight to the centre and only take 10-15 mins. Prices for a bus (single) is £1.60 and for a day saver (all over Edinburgh and unlimited use) is £4. Make sure to have the correct change on the bus as the driver won't give you change.  Alternatively you can walk into town in 30 or so minutes or to the shore area in 10 minutes. EDINBURGH TRAMS (DIRECTIONS FROM AIRPORT) We now have trams operating in Edinburgh. It's costs £5 from the airport to the centre for a single fair, or £1.50 for all other zones (excluding the airport) for children (aged 5-15) it costs £2.50 for a single fair from the airport to centre of town or £0.70 for all other zones (excluding the airport)  Before 7am, trams run every 10 minutes.  7am-6.30pm trams run every 8-10 minutes  Afte
fields.neighborhood_overview: As mentioned above, our flat is in the beautiful Newhaven district of the city with outstanding views from our living room of the Firth of Forth and the old Leith Harbour, Ocean Terminal and the Royal Yacht Britannia. There is FREE on street parking straight outside the flat. This flat is also only 10-15 mins away from the City Centre by bus (bus stop straight outside the flat) Locally, there is a great selection of local shops and retail outlets including a 24 hour ASDA supermarket (only a 5 min walk away) and  Ocean Terminal itself. The apartment is only a 10 minute walk away from the popular Leith Shore which boasts fantastic restaurants and bars and also to Newhaven Harbour, which has great seafood restaurants and lovely, cosy pubs. Our flat is in a calm and quiet neighbourhood and the two bedrooms are at the back of the property overlooking the garden.
fields.space: YOU'LL HAVE THE WHOLE APARTMENT TO YOURSELF FOR THE ENTIRE STAY  WITH FREE PARKING This is a sunny, light, high ceilinged flat on the second floor of an Edinburgh Victorian apartment in the Newhaven area of Edinburgh, with views over the Firth of Forth to Fife and The Royal Yacht Britannia. The self catering apartment is fully equipped and has been recently refurbished/decorated and SLEEPS UP TO 4 PEOPLE plus extra room for a baby/toddler  (please note we provide a cot so just ask if you need one set up)  The flat benefits from a comprehensively equipped kitchen, open plan, off the main sitting room area. There is a traditional bathroom with a large, original Victorian cast iron bath and shower as well as an ensuite shower room off the main bedroom. The main bedroom consists of a comfortable king-size bed, dressing table and cheval mirror. The second spacious bedroom has a comfortable king sized bed with wardrobe. There is also a box room which stores the clothes dryer, iron and ironin
fields.access: Guests will have access to the entire flat and the rear garden.

fields.host_about: My name is Zoe and I live with my boyfriend Steven. We welcome you to Edinburgh and hope you enjoy staying in our central Victorian flat. I studied Fashion Design at Edinburgh College of Art and am now a freelance fashion stylist for stills, TV and film.  I'm a total foodie so I'm constantly cooking but equally love going out for dinner and testing out new restaurants, cafes and cocktail bars. Steven is a full time musician and plays gigs all around Edinburgh. Steven and I have both lived in Edinburgh all our lives and know it inside-out, so put our knowledge to the test and ask us any questions about your stay; where to eat and drink, tips on Edinburgh's hot spots and the best way to get around this fantastic and beautiful city :)
fields.interaction: We always aim to meet guests in person at the flat to show them around at a time that is convenient for them, give them keys and answer any questions they may have. Guests are also very welcome to contact us through Airbnb, by phone or email prior to their stay or during their stay. We are always here to help no matter what.
fields.name: Two Bedroom Central Edinburgh Flat Free Parking
fields.summary: Central Victorian two bedroom quiet Edinburgh flat overlooking the sea & The Royal Yacht Britannia. Free parking.  Beautifully decorated & recently refurbished, this flat boasts a living room, kitchen, 2 large bedrooms, an ensuite shower room & bathroom with bath. Close to The Shore and Newhaven Harbour and a 10-15 min drive to the centre.
fields.house_rules: We're generally pretty laid back but we'd really appreciate it if you wouldn't smoke in the flat. It is on the second floor so it is not far to walk down the stairs to have a cigarette outside. Also if you could be respectful to our neighbours and keep the noise level down after 10pm (and not use the washing machine after 8pm) that would be great. We don't allow any parties in this flat. If you could also please take your luggage/suitcases quietly down the flat stairs if leaving early in the morning or late at night so as not to disrupt our neighbours that would be very much appreciated.  Thank you so much  :)
fields.notes: Check in time is from 2pm and check out is from 11 am. If you arrive earlier than this, the Edinburgh bus station in the centre of town holds luggage for just £10. Please let us know in advance when you will arrive so we can arrange to be there to meet you and show you around our apartment. Thank you

fields.neighborhood_overview: A quiet residential neighborhood within a couple of blocks from the trendy shops and restaurants on Abbott Kinney Blvd and a short walk from the famous Venice Canals and Venice Beach.
fields.space: Situated in the grounds of a private home, this detached cottage/guesthouse comes with everything you need for an enjoyable stay in a tranquil setting within walking distance to restaurants, bars, and the beach! Live like a local with accommodation to rival any hotel - for less!! Situated in the grounds of a private home, this detached cottage/guesthouse comes with everything you need for an enjoyable stay in a tranquil setting within walking distance to restaurants, bars, and the beach! The property is located on one of the most picturesque walk streets of Venice.  Only 2 blocks from the trendy shops and restaurants on Abbott Kinney Blvd and a short walk from the famous Venice Canals.  The Venice “walk streets” are another enchanting part of Venice’s history. Homes face each other separated by a footpath instead of a road.  With an eclectic mix of architectural styles the walk streets are a great place to take a stroll in a car-free, pedestrian-friendly environment.  This quiet "artsy
fields.access: ACCESS:   The guesthouse is a separate unit located at the back of our property.**  Guests access the unit and back patio area through our front gate and down a path that runs along the side of our house.  If you have a lot of luggage we suggest that you first check in then we can give you the remote to open the gate to our back alley to drop off your bags.   **Our back yard is divided into an upper and lower patio.  The lower patio is adjacent to the guesthouse and is reserved for the sole use of our guests. We respect our guests privacy and will do our best not to disturb you during your stay.

fields.host_about: Originally from Ireland (Dublin and Belfast) my husband John and I have lived in Ireland, England, Scotland, and Canada before eventually landing in Venice, California in 1986.  Although we retain strong ties with the "old country" we absolutely love living in Venice.  We love to travel and meet new people and Airbnb has allowed us to experience both, as guests and as hosts.  As hosts we want to give our guests a comfortable and affordable place to stay and aim to leave our guests with fond memories of their visit to Venice.
fields.interaction: Supportive but unobtrusive.  We make every effort to respect our guests privacy but are also happy to interact as circumstances dictate.
fields.name: Venice Beach Walkstreet Guesthouse
fields.summary: Situated in the grounds of a private home, this detached cottage/guesthouse comes with everything you need for an enjoyable stay in a tranquil setting within walking distance to restaurants, bars, and the beach!
fields.house_rules: ****CLEANING FEES****  $65....20% discount is offered if you decide to pay this in cash ($50).  Fees are not charged by Airbnb and are due upon departure.  For the first 2 nights' stay the cleaning fee will be WAIVED. From the third night forward the cleaning fee will be applied.  Maximum 2 Occupants - No Pets No Smoking in the guesthouse - but OK in the courtyard. Please do not leave lights, fans, or appliances on when not in the guesthouse. No burning candles indoors. No Parties - while we appreciate that you may have friends and family in the area what we offer is for the comfort of our guests (two people) and is not suitable for entertaining.  We ask that you please respect our home and our neighbors by refraining from inviting others to hang out at our property.  Quiet Time - If you use the courtyard after 10pm please be respectful of our neighbors and keep conversation low.

fields.name: Beautiful Private Basement Suite
fields.notes: This is a private suite. We provide parking. We are centrally located withing walking distance of downtown. We strive to make check-in as convenient as possible. Late night arrivals will be given a code to let themselves in and we accommodate early arrivals as much as we are able. Come stay with us! 2016-BFN-8749
fields.summary: Beautifully remodeled basement suite in lovely victorian home in central Denver
fields.neighborhood_overview: Many historical homes with a beautiful park nearby. Tons of ethnic restaurants, museums, and places of interest within walking distance from our address. There are 4 breweries within a mile; another 6 breweries within 2 miles. Excellent music venues are close by; 2 (Fillmore and Ogden Theater) are a couple blocks away. Public transportation and bike rentals are convenient from our location.
fields.space: Just 2 blocks from Cheesman park. Within walking distance to restaurants, shops, theaters, music venues, and downtown. Buses and light rail (RTD) are available as well as bike rentals. Guests will be staying in a comfortable, clean basement suite. Includes a private bedroom with queen sized bed, additional twin bed and large couch in another room, full bath, washer/dryer, entertainment center, WiFi, and small refrigerator. There is also a backyard deck to relax on. No pets and no smoking allowed in the house. Sorry, we do not allow the use of marijuana on our property.
fields.access: Check-in is 5:15 pm or later weekdays, and 4 p.m or later weekends. Check-out is 10 a.m. every day. At times we are able to accommodate earlier check in. Inquire with us if you would like to check in earlier. There is a lock box on the door if we are not available at time of check-in or if guests want to drop luggage off prior to check in. We now offer a parking space 1/2 block from our house. We generally only accept 3 persons, but would accommodate more in the case of a family with children. Children under the age of 12 are no additional cost. Please let us know if children are coming.
fields.interaction: We are a warm, conversive couple and we enjoy meeting travelers! We also respect your privacy. Come stay with us!
fields.transit: We are walking distance to many attractions and downtown. Public transit is also convenient. We are located 1 1/2 blocks from the #10 bus line that picks up in Cheesman park and runs all the way across downtown on 15th street, providing easy walking access to all downtown transfer stations and light rail. The #10 bus drops off one block from the Denver Convention Center, and ends at the Denver Aquarium. Coors Field is 5 short blocks off the bus line. Uber is also an attractive option - generally $7 or less to anywhere downtown from our address.

fields.host_about: I enjoy traveling and exploration; mountain climbing and the outdoors. I work in the medical field as a Medical Physicist in Radiation Oncology. I have been living in Denver for about 16 years. I like mountaineering quite a bit and have climbed the highest mountain on 3 continents. I love to see and experience different cultures and beautiful landscapes. In 2012, I married Vibeke, and we are happily living in central Denver and enjoy cooking and the outdoors together.
fields.house_rules: Rental Agreement - When you book to stay in our home you agree to abide by all rules under House Rules of our profile as well as the written rules that will be provided to you upon your arrival. Don't worry - they are not that extreme. However, if you break any of the rules you risk the possibility of a cancellation of the remainder of your stay.

fields.name: Rebel Private Room
fields.notes: To become a better host I got my First Aid Certification. I do guarantee your money back if you don’t like my place upon arrival. No questions asked from my side. And the final thing: I would like to make your stay in my home a good experience for both of us. So I would like to inform you about two thing that are really important to me.  First of all direct communication; if there is anything that you want me to know, ask or something that bothers you, please let me know.  Secondly trust is a key value for me.
fields.summary: ★ Location - The best ★ Room - In a '16th century' apartment ★ Internet connection - Fastest available ★ SuperHost - AirBnB chosen few ★ Not satisfied? - Money back guaranteed! Be Aware: - The stairway is steep - No kitchen access - Shared bathroom & toilet
fields.neighborhood_overview: My home is in a 16th century monumental house (2 floors) and is situated in a quieter part of Amsterdam's city center, just a few minutes walk from the lively Dam Square, the canals and all the highlight that this great city has to offer. It is the perfect base for travelers who wish to explore Amsterdam’s nightlife. Many not-to-be-missed historic attractions, museums, and theaters are only a short walk from this listing. Both business and leisure guests will appreciate the room’s proximity to the city's excellent public transport system. I can advise guests regarding bus, train and tram service. Top shopping, bicycle rent shops and canal boats are around the corner.
fields.space: The place and room I am offering is uniquely situated in the historical heart (old city center) of Amsterdam. And fits two people comfortably.  The private room is located on the third floor.
fields.access: Main features of the room: - Fast wifi (my internet plan 200 mb / 20 mb) - Easy access to the room without disturbing anyone when entering and exiting the house. - A very comfortable bed (queen size or two single beds) - A decent working table. - Good heather that can be easily adjusted. - Towels and sheets are included Interesting fact is that the room is located between the Radisson Blu Hotel (with an average price of 270 euro per night) and Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam (average price of 400 euro per night). Bathroom & Toilet Shared toilet and bathroom on the same floor. The bathroom is spacious with a separate bath and shower.
fields.interaction: I am an experienced host that lives in the same apartment, meaning that I will be there for you whenever needed. If your are searching for a private stay, a stay where you can interact with locals or maybe just get introduced to some of Amsterdam hotspots, then I can be a great host for you.
fields.transit: Tram-stop Spui - 400 m (5 minutes walk) Metro stop Nieuwmarkt - 500 m (6 minutes walk) Central Railway Station – 1.1 km (15 minutes walk) Amsterdam Schiphol Airport - 20 km (30 min cab)

fields.host_about:
I am an easygoing and an open-minded guy that loves to travel. My interest in meeting new cultures and people is grounded in my roots, as I am half Dutch, half Peruvian and born in Indonesia. I believe that I have the Peruvian attitude in welcoming my guest and the Dutch approach in managing and setting up my new businesses.

I have explored Amsterdam for many years now and still think that there is much more to find out. The city and the party scene are extremely vibrant, but at the same time offers you plenty of opportunity to relax and just take in the atmosphere. 

AirBnB has been a great platform for me and I am extremely proud that the AirBnB community has rewarded my effort with the Super host status!
fields.house_rules: CLEAN: I expect my guests to leave my apartment in the same state as it was when they arrived.  RESPECT: Have respect for the fellow AirBnB'er, my neighbors (do not disturb them in anyway) and the host :). As this is a ±400 year old house the neighbors respect each other's privacy in terms of noise pollution, especially at night, so please be considerate.  SAFETY: No open flames are permitted anywhere in the house. That means no smoking or candle burning.  PRIVACY:  I expect my guests to respect my property and not take things with them that do belong to me. If violated, guests will be immediately invited to leave the house and no refund will be granted. I am not a mean person, but feel that in opening my home to offer my guests a more affordable and comfortable vacation experience, my request for privacy should be honored without exception. SECURITY: At the ground floor I placed a camera focused on the street door.  These footages I am allowed to use and/or share if needed.  UNKNOWN P

fields.name: Cozy Studio 1 - Perfect for Couple!
fields.notes: Realise that we also live in the building. We live one floor up and we have 3 young kids. You do have your private studio and you don't see us, but if you don't like to be around a family the maybe we are not the best fit for you. Laundry can be done by visiting the laundromat at “Kanaalstraat " ( € 8,-) Out the door, turn right. Then take the second street right. This is the “Kanaalstraat". There is a laundromat on the corner on the left side of the street
fields.summary: A private and warm studio for 2 people!  The studio is equipped with a private toilet, shower and little kitchen. This studio has 2 one person beds that can easily be put together. Of course with private access and keys! Towels and bedding included... This studio is on the 4th floor of our building, there is no elevator. We live 1 floor below and will help carry luggage up of course. Just a 5 minute walk from tramline 1 and Vondelpark and 10 minutes from the Van Gogh and Rijksmuseum
fields.neighborhood_overview: The Studio is situated in a nice quiet neighborhood, very close to the canal zone. (Check the reviews)  Close to the studio you will find: - 2 minutes from a variety of shops - 2 minutes from breakfast pubs (smoking and non-smoking) - 2 minutes from laundromat  - 2 minutes from steam cleaning services - 5 minutes from lunch cafes - 5 minutes from a lot of restaurants (Italian, Indian, Greek, African, Indonesian, Thai) - 5 minutes from the city center - 5 minutes from Leidseplein - 15 minutes from Central Station - 20 minutes from Schiphol Airport Attractions The studio is very close to world famous attractions. Think of: - 2 minutes from Vondelpark - 5 minutes from Van Gogh Museum  - 5 minutes from the Rijksmuseum - 10 minutes from Amsterdam Forest - 10 minutes from Diamand Museum - 10 minutes from House of Bols - 15 minutes from the Heineken Experience - 15 minutes from Canal Cruises - 20 minutes from Anne Frank House - 20 minutes from Jordan Area
fields.space: Are you looking for a great place with lots of privacy and free wifi in Amsterdam?  We offer our completely private and warm studio, with private entrance & your own set of keys for two people!   The studio is located on the 4th floor and it's one floor above our apartment at the 3rd floor. We are located in a lively neighborhood right in the center of Amsterdam called "Old West"! The cozy studio is equipped with: - Private entrance! - Your own set of keys - 2 One person beds - Bedding for both beds - A private shower - Free clean towels - Shower gel & shampoo - Private toilet - A small fridge for your beers and salads - A microwave - A toasty machine - The studio is decorated with plants! :) - Also tea & coffee facilities - Wireless Internet, obviously free Public Transport The Studio can be reached by Tram 1 from Central Station. This tram line is 3 minutes away from the Studio. Also, the studio is located at a 2 minute walk from a bus station with bus connections to the airport. The
fields.access: Your studio is private, this means that you can come in and out without having to go through some one's space. The studio is located on the 4th floor of our building. No curfew. We supply you with a code for the front door and keys for the studio.
fields.interaction: The main interaction will be through the message system of airbnb. This way we keep everything available in one place. And of course we make use of phone, text message and (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN)... +(PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN) We live in the same building as where our 4 listings are located, but the listings have their separate and private entrance. So obviously we are available for 'face-to-face' contact as well! Finally, we have a whiteboard and a marker on our door. So if we are out, our guests can also communicate by leaving messages on our door.
fields.transit: Getting around is really easy as we are a 3 minute walk away from the main tram line #1.  This tramline will get you from us to Central Station right through the canal district in 15 minutes or less. Also, we are located very close by a bike rental shop. Walking from us to the canal district is only 15 minutes and of course you can make your walk extra nice by taking the route through Vondelpark! Finally, we are a 2 minute walk away from a bus station that connects you to the airport. This is a 20 minutes 'door to door' connection between the airport and us!

fields.host_about:
We're a married couple for life and we love it! Floor is truly an Amsterdam born and raised lady. And Hans grew up in Indonesia and has traveled extensively. 42 countries and counting! Together with our daughter Nikita (4) our son Skyler (3) and Scott (1) we form a happy family! 

Floor and I both love people! We have many friends and meeting new people and making new friends is a way of life for us. 

Floor is very creative. 

Hans loves traveling.

Floor is very musical.

Hans is not musical at all!

Floor is working as a creative entrepreneur, giving workshops, she paints and likes to encourage other people. 

Hans is an online entrepreneur, building a brand around kids toys. 

Floor is born in Amsterdam so therefor she is a true "Amsterdammer"

Hans is in love with the city of Amsterdam and loves to help people with how to explore Amsterdam.

Come over and stay with us, 
we would love to get to know you!
fields.house_rules: Check-out is at or before 11:00 AM. From 11:00 AM, our amazing cleaning team will come and start cleaning.  NO SMOKING AND NO DRUGS PLEASE Umbrella's are free to use, but please leave them in the studio after check-out Things can break. That's life. We would appreciate it if you just tell us so we can replace it For questions, it's best to sent a message on Airbnb.

fields.transit: If you rent a car, you may find it convenient to leave it parked at our place and take one of many public transportation options. We are very close to the D6 and X8 bus lines, which will take you downtown, near the monuments, or to Union Station, where you can take the metro nearly anywhere you want to go. We are also just 1 block away from a large bikeshare station. If you're unfamiliar with bikeshare programs, we encourage you to (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) "Capital Bikeshare" and see what it is all about. In nice weather, it is a great way to experience the city (that is, if you're comfortable on bicycles).   We have a few maps in the room, but have found many guests bring their own, or prefer to use a mobile device to navigate.
fields.neighbourhood_cleansed: Union Station, Stanton Park, Kingman Park
fields.street: Capitol Hill, Washington, DC 20002, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is unique: we are between two bustling areas (H ST NE and Eastern Market). Both of those areas are full of restaurants, bars, shops, and positive urban energy. Our block, and the ones immediately adjacent, are home to quiet families who enjoy the nearby amenities, but also the relative tranquility of our flower and vegetable gardens.
fields.host_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
fields.space: Welcome to the nation's capital--we love it here and we want to help you enjoy it too! The Space: Queen size bed with clean sheets/duvet cover/towels for each new guest.  A spacious efficiency, basement apartment complete with a private bathroom, mini-fridge, microwave and hot water pot and Keurig single cup coffee maker.   We'll provide some drinks and a few snacks to get you going as well as tea and coffee you can make in the room The location: We have a beautiful corner lot row house in NE Capitol Hill, a few blocks from the budding H ST NE neighborhood.  We are close to multiple bike share racks (one block to the closest)  about a mile/2km to the Capitol building, Union Station, and Eastern Market, respectively Who we are: Adam and Jen are your hosts.  Adam works a government job by day and makes custom hardwood furniture by night and weekend; Jen is a Physician Assistant by day and has built a beautiful garden in our yard, sews, and does all sorts of crafty things.  Our dog, Britt
fields.access: Guests have a private entrance to the room, access to their own TV, Fridge, bathroom, and microwave. Wireless internet is available with Netflix and Pandora streaming through the TV via Roku.  Upon request, we can provide access to the washer/dryer.

fields.host_about:
We LOVE living here.  We like meeting new people, enjoying the outdoors, being creative and crafty, and seizing the day.

We hope to provide you with a comfortable place to explore the city--we'd love to help you get around and enjoy your time here as much as we do.
fields.interaction: We love to meet our guests and occasionally chat with them between their trips. We are happy to answer any questions and fulfill reasonable requests.  Occasionally, guests join us for a drink or participate in small gatherings at our home. Otherwise, we assume most guests choose our listing so they can have a unique experience and their own space; but if you want to hang out, just let us know!
fields.name: Efficiency suite in Capitol Hill
fields.summary: Our private suite is in a quiet, family friendly neighborhood with bus, metro, walking or bicycling access to the National Mall and downtown DC. Private bath as well as kitchen amenities such as a mini fridge, keurig, microwave & electric tea kettle.
fields.house_rules: 1. Please only request a ONE NIGHT stay if it is the only night open or we are within 2 weeks of your arrival.  Since we do the cleaning and laundry this is a lot more work for us.  2. Please communicate your arrival time (after 2 pm) if you will be arriving prior to 2pm please let us know and you can store your bags in a seperate room prior to check in. 3. Check out is 10am if you need to store your bags after check out time we can also accommodate that.  Just please let us know ahead of time. 4. No smoking 5. No pets This is a safe, urban neighborhood--kids play outside with minimal supervision, people are generally friendly, and you can walk to bars and restaurants without trepidation.  However, it is a city neighborhood--please be careful at night, do not leave valuables in your car, and pay attention to your surroundings. It is a safe, peaceful residential neighborhood with excellent access to SF's urban center. fields.description: New renovated Garden Suite with separated entrance, private Living room, private Bathroom Newly renovated Garden Suite with separated entrance, private living room, bed room, bathroom. You have total privacy during your stay. Our house is in Central Richmond, San Francisco which is close to the Golden Gate Bridge and Golden Gate Park.  It is a safe, peaceful residential neighborhood with excellent access to SF's urban center.  Your lovely garden suite has a private entrance, with  - Access to garden - Private Bathroom (attached) - Private Entrance - Fast WiFi (Wireless Internet)  - Queen-sized bed - sofa bed (69 in / 175 cm long) - alternatively, an aerobed is provided upon request.  - Table and Chairs - Microwave and Refrigerator - Hairdryer - Iron and iron board upon request - Laundromat half a block away YOUR LOCATION  3 minutes walking to Golden Gate Park. 10 minutes driving to Golden Gate Bridge Public transportation goes to downtown, Union Square, Chinatown, museums,  beaches, ma

fields.notes: Easy to find.
fields.summary: This is a Great Bedroom located in Manhattan!
fields.neighborhood_overview: Food and transportation is close.
fields.space: New Update: Premium bed. Bed is not soft in the middle and hard on the ends. You will not sink into the bed. Bed is comfortable and expensive. No headboard and footboard so you can easily get out of bed without waking person sleeping next to you. New York is exciting and in this apartment you can meet people from all over the world. I have INSTANT BOOK so there is no need to ask if the place is available. If it is free on the calendar then it is free for booking. Also the price is exactly what comes up when you enter your desired dates. Best deal on Airbnb Manhattan! I live in the apartment and you will live here also.  I have many guests giving me their input and I have everything from rubbing alcohol to band-aids to scissors. Do not go to a hotel where you must purchase all these items at an expensive gift shop. fields.host_about: I want to make your airbnb experience perfect. Travelers need a kitchen with supplies to avoid walking outside to make purchases. Hotels are expensive. Save money and stay with me.
fields.house_rules: How you are arriving so I write directions. Send a message when you are 1 hour away. There is a buzzer on the left of door press buzzer '18'. Or use lockbox on wall before steps combination 0018. We don't have many rules! On your arrival, we will give you a set of keys to the apartment. You are free to come and go as you please; there is no curfew. We will not enter your room while There is no need to strip the bed or do any cleaning before you leave. For longer stays (one week or more), we can replace your towels for you midway through your stay if you like. If you are flying, it is helpful if you give us your airline and flight number before you leave. That way, if your flight is delayed, but you can't call because you are in the air, we can check your flight status online and plan accordingly. Our only real "house rules" are that we don't allow smoking, illegal drug use, or pets. Be nice. We look forward to hosting you!
