fields.name: Charming room in spacious apartment
fields.notes: An excellent quality / price ratio.
fields.summary: Charming room (16m2), in a bright and quiet apartment, safe and secure exceptionally located near the Bastille district, Le Marais and Nation. Breakfast included with fresh french bread . Lively neighbourhoods. Supermarket, grocery stores, bakeries. Breakfast included.
fields.neighborhood_overview: The apartment is extremely well located in the Bastille area, walking distance from République, Oberkampf and Nation, which are attractive, lively neighbourhoods, with great nightlife. You will find many shops next door and a delightful mix of fine and trendy dining venues. All amenities just around the corner: supermarket, grocery stores, bakeries, wine shops, post office etc.
fields.space: The apartment features three bedrooms: mine and two that are available for Airbnb guests, a big kitchen with dining room and a separate toilet. I have my own bathroom with toilet. There is a second bathroom with shower for Airbnb guests only. If needed for long stays, a washing machine is also available.
fields.access: Hours check-in and check-out are totally flexible. You have a key that allows you to enter and exit whenever you want respecting of course the calm of the apartment. I'll give you all tips you need.
fields.interaction: About ten days before your arrival I send you my complete address and phone number. When you communicate me your arrival time and according to your place of arrival I write you the best way to get to the apartment.  I inform you about the district and give you the advice of visits, strolls, shows (entertainments), restaurants...
fields.transit: Great transport service, with two metro lines and three bus stops within 5 minutes walk, connecting you to many places in Paris: Metro line 9 to the Champs-Élysées and the Trocadéro. Metro line 8 to Opéra shopping district and to Place de la Concorde. Bus 76 to the Louvre, the modern art museum and exhibition centre Centre George Pompidou, and the trendy Marais district. Bus 86 to Saint-Germain-des-Près, fashionable Rive Gauche district. Bus 56 to Place de la République, train stations Gare du Nord and Gare de l'Est. Easy and affordable access to and from both Roissy-Charles de Gaulle and Orly airports via train or bus. If you are coming from Beauvais airport into Paris via Porte Maillot, the apartment is a 30 minutes metro ride away.  Easy and quick access to the four main railway stations of Paris: Gare du Nord (Eurostar), Gare de Lyon, Gare d'Austerlitz and Gare de l'Est, by metro or bus. There are two stations of VELIB, a self-service bike system, just downstairs in front of the bu

fields.host_about: I am a fifty-eight year old woman whose daughter has just left to go off to London. With my empty nest, I have decided to welcome travelers. I know and love Paris dearly. I enjoy sharing my knowledge of the city with my guests so that they have the best visit possible.

fields.name: Amsterdam Houseboat 'Centre'
fields.notes: Extra options are breakfast, fill-the-fridge, a private boat tour and a parking space. Hope to welcome you soon!
fields.summary: At first you will be surprised with how quiet and peaceful it is on the inside of the boat. On a good day there will be a lot of boats active on the water and you'll feel you are at the most central point of Amsterdam. Living on a boat like this gives you all the comfort (central heating, airconditioning, cable tv, et cetera), but also a feeling best described as 'freedom'. The boat is fixed of course, but the slight movements give you the feeling you are not attached to the rest of the world.
fields.neighborhood_overview: Being as much central as you can get there is A LOT to do in the neighbourhood. The Utrechtsestraat with the best restaurants, Rembrandt square entertainment area, Waterloo square flee market, Nieuwmarkt cafés, red ligth district, Hermitage museum, the Rembrandt house, et cetera - everything is there! Next to boat a a night store is located, which is open from 8 pm to 2 am.
fields.space: You enter the houseboat from the square directly in front of the 'Stopera'. Down about 5 steps you can go left to a small bedroom (sleeps 2), straight ahead to the rather large bathroom with toilet, seperate bath and shower. If you go right you enter the fully equipped kitchen and the living room. At the dining table you can sit and enjoy the view over the most central bit of the river Amstel. Of course there is also a comfortable couch and a sofa-bed to sleep 2. From the living room you enter the master bedroom with a nice double bed. If the weather is good you can also enjoy the terrace which has sun whenever it shines! From the terrace you'll see the river Amstel, the famous Blauwbrug (Blue bridge) and the Opera. At first you will be surprised with how quiet and peaceful it is on the inside of the boat. On a good day there will be a lot of boats active on the water and you'll feel you are at the most central point of Amsterdam. Living on a boat like this gives you all the comfort (c
fields.transit: If you want to visit other areas in the city, the metro and tram are just a few steps away (subway services 51, 53 and 54, trams 9 and 14, and many (night)buses). Amsterdam Central station takes about 3 minutes and in just a few minutes you can get to the Jordaan or, in the other direction, Artis ZOO.

fields.name: Apartment in Historic Congress Park
fields.notes: NO SMOKING of any kind at this property.
fields.summary: Cozy, comfortable, spacious apartment located in historic Congress Park.  Easy walking distance to coffee shop, restaurants, laundry and grocery store. 2.5 miles from Downtown Denver.  Bus stop and bicycle rental station one block away.
fields.neighborhood_overview: This is a great neighborhood with lots of amenities very close by.  Check out the Guidebook on my listing for location to nearby restaurants, laundromat/cleaners, grocery store,book store, movie theater, Denver Zoo, Denver Botanic Gardens, to name just a few.
fields.space: Spacious 2 bedroom apartment with loft is located on upper floor of a four-square home built in 1902.  Apartment includes living room, full kitchen, full bath (with claw foot bathtub) and access to private roof top patio. Enjoy your morning coffee or wine with dinner on our charming roof-top patio.  Bedroom 1 has queen size bed.  Bedroom 2 has queen size futon. The loft has 2 twin beds. The apartment features hard wood floors, craftsman trim accents, large windows for great views, and lots of charm. Hair dryer, ironing board and suitcase rack for each bedroom.  Complimentary toiletries (shampoo, conditioner, lotions, soap, toothpaste, etc.) for our guests' convenience.  No smoking and no pets please.  Supervised children are welcome.  We take pride in providing a “Green” environment for our guests.  We use eco-friendly, non-toxic, unscented cleaning products.  Recycle bin available for guests’ use.      NO SMOKING - for the comfort of all our guests we maintain a strict no smoking poli
fields.access: We've installed an electronic lock on the entry door to allow easy access to the apartment. No hassles with picking up keys or returning them.
fields.interaction: Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions or concerns.  I'm happy to help.  I can be reached by text, phone call or email, all of which I check frequently.
fields.transit: Whether renting a car or depending on public transportation, you'll be able to get around Denver easily.  There is a bus stop one block away that will have you in downtown Denver in about 15 minutes.  Brochures with bus routes are available in the apartment as is information on several cab companies.  On street parking near the apartment is free and plentiful.

fields.host_about: I love the great outdoors so living in Colorado makes it easy to participate in outdoor activities - biking, hiking, and enjoying the great scenery Colorado has to offer.  Thanks to owning a Kindle I read several books each week.  I like to knit and enjoy food at the great restaruants around Denver especially when dinning with friends.
fields.house_rules: We ask that whenever possible guests check in after 3:00 pm and check out by 11:00 am to make the apartment available for other scheduled guests.  We understand that travel arrivals and departures as well as meetings, vacations, and other activities may not coincide with check-in and check-out times. Whenever possible we will be happy to accommodate your scheduling needs.  Information about accessing wireless internet, cable television and other information is provided when you arrive at the apartment.  NO SMOKING of any kind, no candles, no incense in the apartment.  If you need to smoke, please do so outside the apartment.   NO PETS. NO PARTIES.  We understand that you may be visiting relatives living in the Denver area and may want to have them over to the apartment.  This is not a problem.  Let us know how we can help you best enjoy your visit to Denver. Some guests are allergic to perfumes and scented body products.  Whenever possible,  and for the comfort of all our guests, pleas

fields.house_rules: General You have chosen our FreeRoomTonight service instead of a hotel. This means first of all that we can't give you a 24 hours service. Secondly, we have some house rules that need to be respected in order to make your stay and that of others as comfortable as possible.  For one, we ask our guests to respect each other's privacy.  We much appreciate it if our guests will be careful with the objects in our apartments. Accidents are always possible, but damages need to be paid for. Children's For one child up to 3 years old you don't pay extra, older children's are seen as extra person. Tranquillity Please respect each others well deserved sleep and try to be quiet should you come in at a late hour. Screaming and shouting is not welcome over the day too ;-) Check-in/check-out Rooms are ready after 15.00 hrs. Arrivals are possible at any moment during the day, however, only after deliberation with us. If at your time of arrival in the morning the room is not yet ready, you can always l

fields.neighborhood_overview: Like most of Denver's city close neighborhoods this area is gentrifying.  Houses in this area are constantly being flipped or knocked down to make room for row homes and apartments.
fields.space: This is a 2 bedroom house just under 1000 sq ft.  The interior is updated and you're super close to the city with the benefit of being in a home.  Given that the area is somewhat more suburban, you may want to have a car although it's about a $5-10 Uber ride to the city center.  Generally it's cheaper to grab an Uber than it is to pay for parking. A few notes to potential guests.  The neighborhood is gentrifying.  So you have some really nice houses next to some not so nice ones.  In particular there is a house across the street that is a tragic consequence of hoarding.  The kids own the house free and clear and don't seem to be in a rush to either sell it or clan it up.  You may also see bars on windows.  Tend to be the old school houses.  Houses that have been remodeled take them down.  You should also be aware that the guy next door is working on remodeling his house weekend warrior style.  So, things go in fits and spurts. Inside the house we've dong some updating, but do keep in m

fields.host_about:
36 year old from Denver Colorado.  Work nights tending bar and during the day I'm self employed.  Graduated from the university of colorado at boulder in 2003.  

Denver is home but I have spent lots of time living and traveling abroad.  Mostly in Germany (German major) and western Europe. 

Anything else you'd like to know, please ask.
fields.name: Great Bungalow close to Downtown
fields.summary: 2 bedroom 1 bath place close to downtown.  The inside of the house is clean, tidy and decorated.  The neighborhood is gentrifying.  Just a skip and a jump from the house to downtown, Highlands, Lohi, Sunnyside and the I-25/i-170 interchange.
fields.house_rules: This is a non-smoking house.  So no indoor smoking.  If you do smoke please step outside onto the back patio.  Thanks! We often have people who leave a little something behind. So generally anything you find in the fridge is fair game. If you'd like to bring a pet, please hit me up with details on type and size of the pet!  Generally it's not a problem, the only rule is that they are not allowed to sleep on the beds.  Generally we just want to make sure that the beds are kept for humans/future visitors! Also after your stay please don't make the beds!  I really really appreciate you cleaning up but we generally have to strip the sheets to get ready for the next guests.  If you only use one bedroom during your stay feel free to let us know what as well.  That way we are not wasting water/energy to wash and dry sheets that are already clean. Thanks

fields.transit: •You can check real time bus schedule on (URL HIDDEN) by inquiring about specific bus stop numbers (as below) •Bus to city center 41 C runs every 20-30 minutes. Time to city center 35-40 minutes. Bus stop is called Boroimhe Cherry, stop number 5029. When coming back from town get off at bus stop 5031. •Bus to the airport 102 - runs every 20-30 minutes. Time to the airport 5-10 minutes. Bus stop is called Forrest Road, stop number 6015. When coming from the airport get off at bus stop 6033. •For very early departures to the airport -city bus starts running at 6:45am, but there is a hotel shuttle leaving from a nearby hotel (15 minutes walk) every 30 minutes starting at 4:15 am. •Taxi number: ((PHONE NUMBER HIDDEN). Cost to the airport around €10 - €15.
fields.neighborhood_overview: We live in quiet residential estate, close to the airport but not under the flight path so there's not much noise. Bus stop and supermarket are just around the corner.
fields.space: Very large room with double bed (for 1-2 people) and ensuite bathroom in 2 story house in Boroimhe Estate, close to Dublin Airport. There is a possibility to accommodate up to 2 extra guests in the room on the comfy air-mattress put on the floor.  There is a very large closet in the room, desk with chair and 2 nightstands. Room has its own bathroom with a shower. Large kitchen downstairs with all appliances is open for the guest to use to prepare light meals or snacks in the mornings of evenings. Free wi-fi. We do not own television. Linens and towels are provided and you are welcome to rent appliances such as hairdryer etc. without the cost, if needed. There are basic toiletries in your bathroom and tea/coffee in the kitchen. We do not charge a cleaning fee so we appreciate if you could keep your room tidy and clean up after yourself if using kitchen.  Check-in is from 7pm on weekdays and 4pm on weekends and exact arrival time needs to be agreed in advance. Please contact us prior to

fields.host_about:
Although my birth name is Justyna, everyone uses my nickname - Lorelai. I'm a therapist, writer and artist living in Dublin, Ireland, although originally from Poland. I am a quiet person, interested in spirituality, nature and art.

(URL HIDDEN)
(URL HIDDEN)
fields.interaction: We are open to a friendly chat, but due to work and other commitments, we don't usually have time for more interaction.
fields.name: Double room w/bathroom by airport
fields.summary: Very large room with double bed and ensuite bathroom in 2 story house in Boroimhe Estate, close to Dublin Airport. There is a possibility to accommodate up to 2 extra guests in the room on the comfy air-mattress put on the floor. FREE WI-FI.
fields.house_rules: We live a peaceful life and work from home and appreciate respectful, quiet and kind guests.  Our place is not suitable for children under 7 years old. The place is best suitable for tourists and we do not cater for people looking to move to Dublin. We do not provide long term stay. No smokers, parties or bringing outside guests is allowed. Check-in from 7pm on weekdays and 4pm on weekends - please contact us prior to making reservation to arrange your arrival time, as we are not always able to be home. Last minute changes to arrival time are not possible. Check-out by 12pm.  We don't wear shoes in the house to keep it clean, so it's best if you bring some slippers to wear inside. If using kitchen, please clean up after yourself.
fields.notes: PLEASE NOTE: To make reservation process faster, we would appreciate if you could let us know your arrival and departure times when making a reservation, as it is one of the key issues when approving or denying your request. Once this is arranged, please arrive on time, as we will be arranging our work and other activities around your arrival time. Last minute changes to arrival time are not possible. Thank you!

fields.host_about:
My wife and I are Christian, semi-retired film industry people who thrive on adventure and meeting interesting people. Over the past 15 years I've restored several vintage Airstream trailers and consider them the ultimate in camping comfort. One of my restorations now actually resides in Japan! 
We used to love to travel and camp in our 1957 'FLYING CLOUD' AIRSTREAM but now enjoy allowing others to share the experience without the hassle of driving, towing and fighting for a spot in a crowded and noisy campground. We live on a 40+ acre ranch property (with some overly friendly dogs and horses) in the Santa Monica Mountains- surrounded by thousands of acres of open space and direct access to the famous Backbone Trail, which is renowned for hiking, horseback and mountain bike riding. We are also only 6 miles from the glorious beaches of Malibu. Our hilltop location is the perfect deluxe camping experience, with ocean views, and base to enjoy this unique mountain range and Mediterranean climate which occurs in only 6 places in the world.
fields.name: Airstream Vintage Adventure- Pt. 2
fields.interaction: After check-in guests will enjoy a very private experience, with minimal interaction, although hosts are readily available on the property.
fields.summary: A unique experience for the person who loves nature and vintage American icons. A little rustic, but vastly rewarding. Please read the entire listing and view an extensive photo library to determine if this satisfies your creature comfort quotient!
fields.house_rules: CAMPFIRES ARE NOT PERMITTED BY LAW DUE TO HIGH RISK OF WILDFIRES. SMOKING IS ALSO NOT PERMITTED. UNREGISTERED GUESTS or friends are not permitted to visit or 'hang out' on the property with guests without prior approval by hosts. Unfortunately we are not insured for unregistered guests. The short access road may not be suitable for all vehicles, especially in rainy weather, in which case we will be happy to drive you to/from the venue.  Pick up your groceries before you leave the center of Malibu at Ralph's ( Webb Way), Pavillion's (Heathercliff), or Vintage Grocers at Trancas Canyon (Best). If coming from 101 shop at Trader Joes on Thousand Oaks Blvd, or Vons and Sprouts on Agoura Road/Westlake Blvd.  We are 6.5 miles from any grocery stores and the fresh air WILL make you hungry! If you plan on eating prior to arrival there are lots of choices in Thousand Oaks and Westlake Village.

Includes infants,  NO KIDS of any age! The Lookout is a private studio with a private entrance and private everything else! You will have your own bathroom/ bedroom/ small coffee bar with fridge, microwave, toaster, and tea kettle. You can relax knowing that the Lookout is all yours.
fields.neighborhood_overview: The north slope of Potrero Hill is know for its sweeping views of downtown San Francisco, sunny weather (sunniest in all of San Francisco) and easy access to the best parts of town. We also have some of the City's most excellent restaurants just a block away. The neighborhood is a cool mix of homes and businesses, some warehouses, and lofts.
fields.space: ADULTS ONLY    "Coolest Place to Stay in San Francisco"-  California Home and Garden Magazine.    ADULTS ONLY  The Lookout is a private studio and was designed with the quiet and mature adult in mind, the guest who is looking for a respite in the City, for a place to catch up on much needed sleep and restoration between working, visiting relatives, or exploring San Francisco. You will have complete privacy in the Lookout!  No smoking. Two adults maximum. No parties. No one under 18 on the property. No pets.  Garden Lookout details: The Lookout has its own private entrance at the rear second floor of my home and looks out over the garden to the raised vegetable beds and large grassy area with mature plants and a manicured lawn that is shared with me and my other guests.  Lots of sunlight, fresh air and greenery. Private, quiet, yet steps from City living.  • No cooking- the "Coffee Bar" is perfect for a continental breakfast, or a glass of wine with a cheese plate (small refrigerator, m
fields.access: Please enjoy the beautiful garden! Have a glass of wine or cup of coffee on the chaise lounges.  NO KIDS allowed anywhere on my property! ADULTS ONLY  Please read the House Rules. Laundry available please ask me to show you.
fields.interaction: I live in the main house and my architecture office is on the property so I'm around, we can chat and have a cup of tea or glass of wine in the garden if you have the time.
fields.transit: Take the Third Street light rail to points downtown including North Beach and Fisherman's Wharf,  the Ferry Building Marketplace, Chinatown, and downtown, and take the 22 Fillmore bus to the Mission and the Castro and points west. Public transit is very close to the Lookout.  Super fast Uber and Lyft pickups, first time users can use my code for free rides: Uber: 0ZW76 (that's a zero at the beginning) Lyft: KEPA495343

fields.host_about:
Hi Guests,
Thank you for considering staying with me during your visit to San Francisco. Whether you're coming for business, pleasure, or to visit family, I think you will enjoy my rooms and my neighborhood. 
I've been here in San Francisco and in Potrero Hill since 1978, and I can help you figure out what to do and how to get around. I've had construction and design businesses all my life and I'm enjoying adding Airbnb hosting to my daily routine. I've travelled quite a bit and enjoy having the world come to me!
Here are all of my listings:
Potrero Hill Garden Cabana: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/205842
Potrero Hill Garden Suite: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/33577
Potrero Hill Garden Lookout:https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/33578
Potrero Hill Garden Getaway: https://www.airbnb.com/rooms/918341
Please email me if you have any questions. I hope to hear from you. 
Kepa Askenasy
fields.house_rules: PLEASE READ THE HOUSE RULES •No smoking on the property • No one on the premises under the age of 18 (no infants/ toddlers/ children  or teenagers- including with adult supervision) • Two adults maximum per listing • No partying- please respect that other guests may have jet lag and are sleeping or napping- or that I may be having clients over for business (my architecture office is in the back cottage). We all can get a little too loud with too much to drink so please don't drink too much! •Keep the street door locked at all times •No photo or video shoots or commercial use whatsoever- this is a residential property and my insurance could be voided if you do so (plus it’s inappropriate- this is my home). Personal photos are welcome. • No pets • No parking in my neighbors’ driveway even for a moment, please ask me to show you where to park: PARKING: If you plan on bringing a car (not necessary for touring the City) please tell me ahead of time so that I can explain to you where you can

fields.name: Quiet room in Amsterdam Center
fields.notes: In order to reach the second floor,  you will have to climb two 'Amsterdam ' stairs, pretty steep if  you are not used to it or  you have mobility problems.  I will help you with  your luggage  if necessary. It is highly appreciated  if  you take off  your shoes  in the appartement. House shoes are available.
fields.summary: My apartment is on the 2nd floor of a 17th century monument in a very quiet street in the heart of historical Amsterdam Center, on walking distance from Central Station.  Please be aware that you have to climb two typically 'Amsterdam ' stairs! So pretty steep if you are not used to it or you have mobility problems. Of course I will help you with your luggage.
fields.neighborhood_overview: Nieuwmarkt is around the corner, with cozy pubs, nice restaurants and shops. You are in the very heart of historical Amsterdam. Everything is on walking distance.
fields.space: The guestroom  is on the 2nd floor of a 17th century monument in a very quiet street in the heart of Amsterdam Center, on walking distance from Central Station.  From Central Station, you can also take the Metro (subway)  line 51, 53 or 54. Just one stop after Central Station, get off at Nieuwmarkt, take exit Nieuwmarkt. My address is 100 m away from this Metro exit. The guest room  that I rent out to you is on the backside of the building and therefore very quiet. Therefore, be aware that every sound will be heard by our neighbours,  so please no loud music  or loud conversations. Also: it is highly appreciated when you take off your shoes in the appartement. Clean house shoes will be provided to you.  The entrance of my apartment leads to a hallway.  Shower and toilet are also on that hallway, so you don’t have to go through my livingroom. You will share the shower and  toilet only with me.  There are no other guests. I take out my private things from the bathroom when I have guests.
fields.access: The entrance of my appartment leads to a hallway. Guestroom, shower and toilet are on that hallway, so you don’t have to go through my livingroom.  You cannot use my  kitchen though. You will share shower and toilet only with me,  There will be no other guests. I take out my personal things from the bathroom when I have guests. The bathroom will be all yours! FACILITIES: Queen size bed (1.60 x 2.05 m.), TV, WIFI, Refrigerator, waterboiler and coffeemachine, small table, chair and sofa. Linen, towels, showergel and shampoo available. The sofa can be turned into a bed of 1.40 m wide voor a third person or two children. No Smoking, no pets no drugs, no loud music or loud converstaions  in the room WHAT GUESTS  VALUE EXTRA ABOUT MY GUESTROOM • it is very quiet • it has a very comfortable bed bed • Although in my apartement, still there is enough privacy • very close to all attractions and public transport WHAT GUESTS  VALUE LESS  ABOUT MY GUESTROOM • they have to climb two flights of prett
fields.interaction: The entrance of my appartment leads to a hallway. Guestroom, Shower and toilet are on that hallway, so you don’t have to go through my livingroom. You cannot use my kitchen. You will share shower and toilet only with me,  There will be no other guests. I take out my personal things from the bathroom when I have guests. The bathroom will be all yours! You can use  the shampoo, conditionair, shower gels etc.  Feel free to ask if you have questions, I am also living in the apartement.
fields.transit: No need to come by car, my appartement is ten minutes walking  from  Amsterdam Centaal Station. Everything is on walking distance. If you are tired: Amsterdam has a very comfortable public transport system with trams. If  you insist to come by car: there is a parking garage close to  Amsterdam Centraal station at Oosterdok for €13 per 24 hours  or use one of the  P+R parkings around the city with a fast public transport to the city,  for €1  per 24 hours if  you can  show a public transport card  from  Amsterdam center  back to the P+R.

fields.interaction: I will assist guest in their travels.
fields.summary: This is a Private Bedroom in Manhattan!!
fields.house_rules: How you are arriving so I write directions. Send a message when you are 1 hour away. There is a buzzer on the left of door press buzzer '18'. Or use lockbox on wall before steps combination 0018. We don't have many rules! On your arrival, we will give you a set of keys to the apartment. You are free to come and go as you please; there is no curfew. We will not enter your room while There is no need to strip the bed or do any cleaning before you leave. For longer stays (one week or more), we can replace your towels for you midway through your stay if you like. If you are flying, it is helpful if you give us your airline and flight number before you leave. That way, if your flight is delayed, but you can't call because you are in the air, we can check your flight status online and plan accordingly. Our only real "house rules" are that we don't allow smoking, illegal drug use, or pets. Be nice. We look forward to hosting you!
fields.notes: Easy to find.

fields.transit: This is a great spot for public transportation! We're next to major bus hubs, the light rail train from the airport and the Amtrak station. If you'll be using a lot of public transportation you might want to buy an Orca Card. You can load it up with however much $ you'd like, and then use it for quicker access when boarding the Light Rail train, buses, etc. Orca kiosks can be found near the ticket & boarding areas at most transportation hubs.
fields.street: S Main St, Seattle, WA 98104, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: This is a fun & interesting international neighborhood with lots of quirky shops and tons of food choices. Please check out our online guidebook for lots of recommendations. Please note that we're right next to the Pioneer Square neighborhood, which tends to have a lot of homeless people on the streets. We're used to walking around in this type of city environment, but it isn't for everyone. Though it's generally safer than it might feel, as with most cities we don't recommend walking around by yourself late at night.
fields.space: This is studio #7 - one of two private airbnb rooms (located in the same building). We designed the rooms as simple & affordable spaces for arts-related guests, for brief stays & short-term artist residencies near the heart of Seattle's downtown gallery district. But you don't have to be an artist to stay here - all are welcome! ** Please read our entire listing description before booking - thx! ** This is a quiet private room located among 15 other art studios on the 2nd floor in the Japantown area of Seattle's historic International District. It has an upper bed-loft with a luxurious Novaform queen mattress & very comfortable bedding. The lower portion of the loft has a small loveseat couch (not meant for sleeping), desk & chair, and other basic furniture. Free wifi and satellite TV w/HBO are included. There's a shared kitchenette (not a full kitchen) and 2 shared bathrooms (one with a shower) in the hallway just outside the room. Although there are other artists working in the build

fields.host_about: Hi, we're a married couple living and working in downtown Seattle. We started hosting on airbnb about 3 years ago, and we love it! We currently have 3 listings for you to choose from. The first 2 are single private rooms in an art building near the sports stadiums. Dirk has a contemporary art gallery there and Jaq has her painting studio there, so we're usually around. We also have a 1-bedroom apartment in the center of downtown near the Convention Center and popular attractions like the Pike Place Market. We travel and use airbnb just like you, so we understand what it's like to be a guest. As you can see from our many reviews, we'll do our best to make your stay easy & comfortable. If you have any questions just get in touch!
fields.name: contemporary art loft downtown [7]
fields.notes: Please note that there is a long flight of stairs to get up to our floor and no elevator. Also you need to climb a ladder to get up into the bed loft. And finally just want to make sure you've noticed it is a shared bathroom – not a private bathroom.

fields.name: Denver Victorian / Best Walk Score
fields.notes: We have a kitty and a really nice small 12 lbs dog.  Very sweet pets and are use to visitors.  Dog does not jump up or bark .
fields.summary: An old Victorian house in a quaint old neighborhood with beautiful historical homes.(circa 1880)  Lots of charm--Old trees,  friendly neighbors and very close to downtown and the new RINO Arts District.  RINO is walking distance.  If you love Micros you hit the Jackpot.  RINO has 12 micro's and 23 eateries, 2 music venues and lots of dispensaries.
fields.neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is quaint and full of older homes from the Victorian era. (circa 1880) so there is alot of character in the homes around and every block is a walk in history.  Very walkable...  RINO ARTS DISTRICT easy walk.  Welton Street very close.  No car needed :)
fields.space: We have the best walk score in Denver.   1) Twelve Micro's right in the area:  Our Mutual Friend Brewery, Black Shirt Brewery, Great Divide Brewery, Our Mutual Friend, Ratio, Zephyr, Spangalang, Beryl's, Stem Cider...list goes on! You can walk (15-20 min) or ride a bike if you like OR parking is usually easy so you can drive (5 min) OR if you are worried about drinking too much, a cab is  about $4-$5 so no need to drive or park. Just leave a trail of hops. Oh and I forgot FOOD TRUCKS galore and over 23 eateries! 2) Denver Zoo & Science Museum straight down the street.  Coor's Field 20 min walk. Watch a game in the Rock Pile section for $4-$5 bucks. 3) 17th Street with Steuben's a food channel favorite.  (15 min walk) Over 75 restaurants and  coffee shops all within a 20 minute walk 4) Vegan Central with Denver's newest Vegan Bakery just a 2 min. stroll.  City O City breakfast or Watercourse all 15 minutes walking OR a short bike ride 5) We have bikes and it's a better deal than B-Cycle
fields.access: We have full bath  right next to the bedroom.  We provide a light breakfast:  coffee, bagels and cream cheese, yogurt. There is a deck outside which is lovely in the spring and summer for beers or coffee. Kitchen use outside of breakfast is limited due to the household needs. But can be available for cooking meals.
fields.interaction: We are pretty independent and do not hang out much.  So little interaction.  We do want you to have a great stay and we are available for any ideas on what to do or see.
fields.transit: There are many bus stops around and you can (SENSITIVE CONTENTS HIDDEN) RTD (the transit system in Denver) and just plug in addresses to see how to get to and from anywhere. Walk.

fields.host_about: Hello and welcome  to Denver!   I run a local non-profit.   Travel is one of my greatest passions and I have visited 28 countries.  I enjoy yoga and tennis.  I have two children that are well behaved and sometimes they may be here or not.   We also have a kitty cat.  I am pretty easy going and have flexible work hours  so sometimes I am available to have a cup of tea with my guests -- We have hosted many people from the states and from around the world and enjoy hearing their stories and about their cities Life Motto: Live in the Present Moment
fields.house_rules: This is a great place to stay and we want you to feel at home.  However, we ask that if you register everyone who will be staying in the room--just for safety reasons.  Please no candles, incense, or smoking allowed in the home. No eating in room!  Kitchen is available for a supplied light breakfast of bagels, coffee, tea and milk. All other meals kitchen is not available .  Be reasonable about check-in and try and respect that we may see a movie or have dinner plans outside our home. Please try and arrive when you say you're going to arrive because we may have made plans to do something that day or night.  Just standard courtesy is all we ask when considering that you are coming in late or getting up early.  The inexpensive price would indicate that there is no concierge or mints on the pillow--we love meeting and showing people around Denver, but we are not always available to do that because of work and other obligations.

fields.name: Urban treehouse in Portland, OR!
fields.notes: We have bikes available for rent by guests who'd like to try seeing Portland on two wheels!
fields.summary: A quiet, cozy bedroom & bathroom on the ground floor of a beautiful, modern new home in a verdant, friendly Southeast Portland neighborhood.  Enthusiastic greeting by very friendly dog & cat comes standard!
fields.neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is so great!  We are really close to several cool Portland hubs, but we're on a relatively quiet residential street so we truly have the best of all worlds.
fields.space: PLEASE READ THE ENTIRE LISTING BEFORE REQUESTING ACCOMMODATION. As a courtesy to our guests, our check-in time is 3:00 pm; however, as we both work weekdays, we cannot have the rooms ready until 5:00 or so.  What this means is that our guests are welcome to make themselves at home in their living room or just drop their bags off and head out exploring, but they won't be able to rest their weary heads or hit the showers until we've had a chance to get home and tidy up. (PLEASE NOTE: This listing highlights the primary guest bedroom available, but for parties of 3 or 4 people, we do have a secondary bedroom that also features a queen-sized bed.  All guests share the same bathroom, but the second bed shown on the listing is NOT in a common space, it is in its own private bedroom.) There is almost an entire floor available in our brand-new home smack-dab in the heart of fun, accessible Southeast Portland!  This means that our guest(s) get not only their own quiet bedroom, but also a privat
fields.access: You have a floor of your own, where your bedroom, bathroom and a sitting area are located.  You are also welcome up a level, where the kitchen and our living room are situated.  Bikey guests are welcome to park their rides in our garage.
fields.interaction: We interact with our guests as much or as little as they want - we've connected brilliantly with guests who've had the time and inclination to chat us up, and we've had quite a few guests we never even met face-to-face!  We are perfectly content to allow our guests to determine what kind of relationship they have with us.
fields.transit: Public transportation in Portland is excellent!  Not only does the light rail line run all the way to our wonderful airport, but the buses are all clean and on time, and the drivers are quite friendly and helpful.  If you want to have wheels of your own so you can explore areas outside the city, that's great, but you don't have to have a car in town to get around comfortably and conveniently.

fields.host_about:
We are a youngish married professional couple who have lived in Portland for about a dozen years.  Brad has traveled the world, and we are both thrilled to have the opportunity to make our home available to other adventurous wanderers.  Becca is a professionally-trained culinary hobbyist who makes a living as an accountant, and Brad loves his job as a high school teacher.  We're into good vittles, ample coffee, riding our bikes, taking in plays, movies, and comedy shows, getting together with friends, and spending time together in our beautiful home.

We're happy to spend social time with our guests, but we have no problem leaving them to their own devices and plans if that's how they've structured their visit.  We look forward to meeting you!
fields.house_rules: We enjoy getting to know our guests, but we understand that most people who stay with us have plans that keep them occupied away from the house most of the time during their stay.  What you can expect from us: we are pretty quiet and mellow and when we do entertain, festivities usually wind down by 11:00pm on the weekends.  You are always welcome to hang out with us when we're relaxing at the homestead, but we will not be put out if you choose to do your own thing.

fields.notes: There's off-street parking available for free.
fields.summary: -Upstairs room with a queen sized bed (TempurPedic mattress!) - Private, attached bathroom ensuite - 1 MILE to The Gulch, Germantown Restaurants & Baseball Stadium - 2 MILES to Titans Nissan Stadium (NFL), Ryman Auditorium, Broadway Entertainment District, Predators Bridgestone Arena (NHL), Ascend Amphitheater - 3 MILES to Vanderbilt University, Centennial Park (Parthenon), Hillsboro Village, 12 South District & East Nashville - 4 MILES to Bluebird Cafe & Mall at Green Hills
fields.neighborhood_overview: The area my home is in is called the Capitol District. Why? It sits in the shadow of the Tennessee Capitol Building, the seat of our State government. You can look the area up if you want more information. It is truly a wonderful area, and its undergoing an amazing renaissance that will bring even more amazing bars and restaurants, housing options, and outdoor spaces to live, work and play. It's one of Nashville's hottest areas in which to live. First Tennessee Park, the home of the AAA MiLB Nashville Sounds, is 4 blocks from my home. Nashville's diverse dining, entertainment, and cultural events at your doorstep, the Germantown/Hope Gardens/Historic Buena Vista neighborhood is the perfect location for guests visiting Nashville. The Germantown area was placed on the National Register of Historic Places in 1979 and contains beautifully diverse architecture spanning from the early 1800s to present. This close-knit community features unique events such as the annual Oktoberfest Street Fes
fields.space: You'll stay in a private bedroom with a queen sized TempurPedic bed and a private, connected bath on the 2nd floor of my 9 year old home. Convenient to downtown, safe, clean and comfortable. My home is well decorated, modern, and close to EVERYTHING! I am looking forward to having you stay with me.  When you are one of my guests, you are part of the house and part of the family. No security deposit. I just ask that you treat my house like its your own. I have a small 16lb. Jack Russell Terrier that is quiet and stays in her crate. She's a cutie. Everybody that meets her wants to abduct her and put her in their suitcases.  Free wireless internet, coffee/tea/drinks, hairdryer, steam iron, and HDTV with Apple TV provided. When I can accommodate (especially for international guests that arrive at Nashville International Airport), I'm happy to give free rides to downtown or the airport. I also provide toiletries (soap  shampoo, lotion, medicines, hairspray) and towels and fresh linens for y
fields.access: I have a small 16lb. Jack Russell Terrier that is quiet and loves new people. She's a cutie. Literally everybody that meets her wants to abduct her and put her in their suitcases.  Wireless internet, coffee/tea/drinks, hairdryer, and an HDTV are also in the room, with a Roku connected so you can watch TV or log into Netflix, Hulu or Amazon Prime TV. There is a dedicated refrigerator for your use in the closet. When I can accommodate (especially for international guests that arrive at Nashville International Airport), I'm happy to give free rides to downtown or the airport. I also provide toiletries (soap  shampoo, lotion, medicines, hairspray) and towels and fresh linens for your queen sized TempurPedic bed during your stay. There is also a hair dryer and a iron and ironing board in the room to use at your disposal.
fields.interaction: My guests are my friends. Hosting on airBnB has been such a blessing to me. I love it! You'll have your own key to the house once you check-in. When you arrive, i'll help you get your bags, park, and catch your breath. Once we get a chance to say hello, I'll take you up to the room, give you the wireless key for your tablet, laptop, or mobile phone.  Come and go, as much as you'd like--late or early. You're welcome to hang out with me and my friends if you'd like. I've taken guests to the bar with my buddies. I've tagged along with them. We often go to dinner together. I love getting to know my guests! That's the main reason I host. If you're new to the South, don't be shocked by my kindness. I'm from Alabama and we treat guests like family where I come from. I have developed a 20 minute tour [by car] of the downtown area to highlight key places and areas you might want to visit while on your stay. This is obviously up to your discretion (and my availability), but I am more than happy
fields.transit: Uber/Lyft

fields.host_about:
I'm a 34 year old bachelor living [the good life] in Nashville, TN. I built my home 9 years ago, just 2 miles from the city center and the incredible live music that made Nashville famous. 

I've housed over 1300 total Airbnb guests since I began hosting in April 2013. I've also received the designation of Airbnb SuperHost. I know that if you come stay the night or week, you'll have a wonderful time in Nashville, with my home as your home base. I'm happy to make restaurant recommendations and guide you towards transit options, and "must see" sights and sounds. 

I LOVE taking my guests [that are new to Nashville] out by car to show them the area on a brief, but thorough, 30-minute tour of the downtown area. The goal of the tour is to get you familiar with the many things  there are to see and do in Nashville. With that information in hand, I hope you will feel adequately equipped to hit the ground running. Hopefully, you'll learn something you didn't know about our town that would enrich your trip and help make it especially memorable for you. Making your trip special is why I host on Airbnb. That's what makes this experience different than a night at the local chain hotel.

My home is 1.5 miles from the Gulch, 2 miles from Broadway bars, two blocks from the Nashville Farmers Market and three blocks from First Tennessee Park, home of the Nashville Sounds baseball team. I'm 3 miles from Vanderbilt, 2 miles from both Nissan Stadium and Ascend Amphitheater, and 1.5 miles from Bridgestone Arena. I'm a $6 uber ride to anything downtown and $8 to Vandy or Centennial Park in the West End of Nashville. I'm well connected to the nightlife and social scene here in town, so i'm also happy to point you to places I go. The invitation always exists for you to hang out with me and my buddies when we head out, for those of you that might be traveling alone or in a pair. 

Hands down—Airbnb is "the" best new activity i've introduced into to my life in recent years. I've stayed as an Airbnb guest myself, and i've hosted hundreds of people just like you. I can't imagine my life without Airbnb. 

What an amazing experience! Come join me.

fields.transit: El apartamento está cerca de las estaciones de tren y de autobuses, a unos 15 minutos andando, y también cerca de la Alameda Principal y del Muelle Heredia, desde donde salen todos los autobuses urbanos y los que recorren la costa, además de los trenes de cercanías.  Es muy fácil llegar desde el aeropuerto, el tren tarda sólo 11 minutos en llegar y la estación de Cercanías está a solo 10 minutos andando. A pesar de estar en el centro de la ciudad es fácil encontrar aparcamiento en los alrededores. Puedo ayudarte con alguna recomendación.
fields.neighborhood_overview: It's a special zone where the traditions are enjoyed by people. It's possible to see the processions in Holly-week (Easter week), "La fiesta de los patios" which is decorate their patios with flowers and people can come to visit them. Moreover, flamenco is breathed in every street. Right in Málaga city center, in one of the most famous streets in the city. By foot, only 5 minutes away from Picasso museum and just 2 minutes from Thyssen Museum. Very close to "Alameda Principal" and "Muelle Heredia", where all buses start their route to other costal cities, airport and train stations.  From the balcony you can see the procession of "El Cautivo", one of the Easter processions of the city's best-known
fields.space: I offer a bright and spacious bedroom with air conditioning/heater in this charming apartment, very quite and in a centrical area. My house has all the facilities to make your stay very comfortable: It has Wi-Fi, a full equipped-kitchen, washing machine and a bedroom with a big and very comfortable bed. (I can also put a cot for a baby) If you like music and reading you might be interested in my private library, focused on spanish poetry and vinyl discs.
fields.access: Si te gusta la música y la lectura te interesará saber que el apartamento tiene una completa biblioteca, especializada en poesía española y arte, y una interesante colección de discos de vinilo.

fields.transit: The apartment is 400 metres (5 minutes) from the bus stop (Carlyle place) at London Road. During the day you have many buses such as number 26 or 104 taking you to Princes Street (Waverley train station and the bus station) or the Royal Mile. There is also a night bus (N26) which runs after 12am. Buses cost £1.60 single and £4.00 day ticket. You need exact change and buy them from the bus driver. Also 500 metres away and next to Holyrood Palace, you will find the bus stop for the Tourist City Bus Tour and bus 35 which takes you to the middle of the Royal Mile (£1.60, 3 minutes) or the airport for £1.60 and an hour ride. Bus tickets are also bought from the bus driver. A taxi from Waverley train station, bus station, Airlink last bus stop or the last tram bus stop lasts 5 minutes and costs around £6. A taxi from the airport to my house should cost around £21 and last roughly 25 minutes. It takes roughly 20 minutes to walk from Waverley train station or Waverley bridge (last stop of Airl
fields.neighborhood_overview: Abbeyhill is a quite residential area behind Holyrood Palace and the Royal Mile. There are plenty of buses to get to the city centre or you can walk easily to the Old or New Town from here. You will find Meadowbank shopping centre 500 metres (6 minutes) away from the house where the big supermarket Sainsburys is located.  There is a good selection of places where to eat and drink in the neighborhood or you can go for a stroll in the park. Also the Royal Mile, main street in the Old Town, is just 5 minutes walking distance from us so there are plenty of good restaurants, pubs and all the main attractions nearby.
fields.space: My lovely flat is located in a very quiet area behind Holyrood Palace (bottom of the Royal Mile), next to Holyrood Park and 15 minutes walking distance to the city centre so it is an excellent base to discover the history, attractions and nature this amazing city has to offer.  The house sits in the second floor of a typical Edinburgh tenement flat with high ceilings, large rooms, gas central heating, double glazing and electric hot shower. The bedroom size is 5 by 4 square metres and features a double bed, one wardrobe, a sofa, a desk and a chair.
fields.access: There is free WiFi internet, fresh towels and bed linen and access to the shared bathroom and a hair dryer. In your room you will find a welcome tray with a kettle, a water jug, tea, coffee, sugar, milk and a pastry. There is also an iron and iron board available and if you need to do your laundry I can do it for you.

fields.host_about:
I am originally from Spain but I have been living in Edinburgh for the past 20 years. I love travelling and I am fascinated by meeting people, other cultures, learning new recipes, enjoying any type of arts this city can offer and finding out about myself in the process. I have been almost in every attraction in Edinburgh as well as visited most of Scotland so I can give you plenty of information about many Scottish attractions, food, entertainment and transport. 
Edinburgh is an amazing place to visit and I hope you enjoy it as much as I do.
fields.interaction: I will welcome you at home for the handover of keys and show you the room. I have a good knowledge of my gorgeous city so I will be delighted to give you any tips and suggestions if you want me to and there is also a folder in your bedroom with general information about the city, its attractions, and restaurants as well as a Scottish guidebook for your use.
fields.name: Comfy Room behind Holyrood Palace
fields.summary: Cosy and large room in quiet area 5 minutes walk from Holyrood Palace/Parliament and bottom of the Royal Mile, and next to Holyrood Park. Flexible check in/out, free parking on street & great transport links. Excellent base to discover the history, attractions and nature this amazing city has to offer!!!
fields.house_rules: Shoes are not allowed in the house. Please wear slippers. We like to be tidy and quiet and would appreciate if our guests respect these principles.  Only our guests are allowed inside the flat unless agreed with us before hand. Please be aware there is not access to the kitchen.
fields.notes: You can find another listing in Airbnb for the second room and a flat. On arrival, please press the buzzer (2F1) and I will let you in.

fields.name: Private Suite in Capitol Hill Home
fields.notes: We have a dog, Lily, and a cat, Little Rock. Both are friendly but we keep them out of the guest areas just in case guests have allergies. Lily barks at guests when they arrive, but she quiets down quickly.  We do not have cable TV, but we have free wifi and a Roku box you can use to watch TV shows or movies on Netflix.  While the room has one big window that lets in natural light, the window does not open directly to the outside (it opens to a small room where we store our bicycles and some tools). You can hang out in our backyard for fresh air.  In order to keep costs low and simple, we do not charge a cleaning fee. Kindly use the garbage bins in the alley (green for trash, blue for recycling). We would appreciate it if you would strip the bed when you check out, and leave the linens in a pile with your used towels. Thank you! Listing our space on Airbnb has made it possible for us to live in a neighborhood that we otherwise would find it very difficult to afford, plus we get the cha
fields.summary: Our private suite is in a quiet, family friendly neighborhood with great bus, metro, walking or bicycling access to the National Mall and downtown DC. Private bath, mini fridge, microwave & electric tea kettle.
fields.neighbourhood_cleansed: Union Station, Stanton Park, Kingman Park
fields.street: Capitol Hill, Washington, DC 20002, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: Our neighborhood is a village in a city! There are beautiful, well kept row houses, some apartment buildings, shady parks, and very friendly people. We live right backed up to a park where families bring their children to play soccer. We love to walk and bike everywhere and you can see the Bikeshare kiosk from our backyard. We are about a mile walk from two metro stations (Union Station and Eastern Market) and 2 blocks from the D6 bus that goes to the National Mall, downtown, and even all the way to Georgetown.
fields.space: Convenient to the National Mall and an easy walk to Union Station, Eastern Market, Barracks Row/8th Street, H Street/Atlas District,the Library of Congress, Folger Theater, and the Capital buildings. Great for business trips, research trips or sightseeing.  Enjoy a cozy room and private full bath on the ground floor of our recently renovated home. Wifi, bike share across the field behind our house, bus & metro nearby, walk to tons of restaurants in two of DCs best neighborhoods for dining (Barracks Row/Eastern Market and H Street), museums and everything else great about DC very close by!  There is a very basic kitchenette in the room (mini-fridge, microwave and electric tea kettle). If you have additional kitchen needs you can come upstairs and use our kitchen.  ABOUT THE ACCOMMODATIONS -1 Bedroom -1 Full Bath - private  -Privacy: You may close the bedroom and bathroom from the rest of the house -Private entrance -Wifi -Window -Heating unit / air conditioner whose temperature you cont
fields.access: You will have your own bedroom and private bath. There is a microwave, utensils, and an electric tea kettle in the room, but if you'd like to use our kitchen or need other supplies, we can help you out with that. To get to our room, you enter our basement door, walk through a room where we store our bikes, and then enter your room.
fields.interaction: We respect that guests want different levels of interaction or privacy. We try to be as helpful and as available to orient our guests, but we will let you be. We very much enjoy meeting people from around the world by hosting guests through Airbnb. Our daughters are working on saying goodnight in as many languages as possible!  We don't travel a lot, but occasionally go out of town on the weekend. If this is the case for your visit, we will try to let you know in advance and we have neighbors who also host on Airbnb and they will be available to help you. We can always be reached by phone or text. This has worked out in the past and some of our awesome guests have even fed and pet our cat while we are away.
fields.transit: The closest public transportation to our house is the D6 bus two blocks away at the corner of 13th and C Streets NE. You can also pick up an X8 bus 3 blocks away on Maryland Ave or the X2 bus 5 blocks away on H Street.  There is a small market 4 blocks away (corner of 11th and C Street NE), and bigger grocery stores by Eastern Market metro, Union Station, and Potomac Ave metro, all accessible by bike or on your way home from downtown.
fields.host_location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States

fields.house_rules: Check in: After 2pm / Check out: 9 am weekdays, 10 am weekends.   Arriving early? Leaving late? If you need a place to store your bags before the room is ready or after you check out you are welcome to leave them our storage room.

fields.transit: The city centre shops on Princes St. are less than a 20 minute walk and Holyrood Palace on the Royal Mile is less than 10 minutes walk. From there it's a lovely and historic walk up to Edinburgh Castle. A good bus service runs every few minutes (24 hours, £1.60 fixed fare) from the top of the road to Princes Street and the Old Town, Edinburgh Tour Buses also stop nearby. The nearest tram stop is York Place (15 min walk) and from here you can get the tram directly to Murrayfield Stadium in 15 minutes and to the airport in 35 minutes.
fields.neighborhood_overview: Abbeyhill is a safe and friendly, city centre neighbourhood where lots of local Edinburghers live. Just around the corner are a good selection of shops including an excellent artisan baker/patisserie, an Italian cafe and a brilliant independent wine shop. There’s a great contemporary Indian restaurant/takeout, an excellent Thai restaurant/takeout, an acclaimed local/seasonal restaurant and a well respected Italian very close by. Edinburgh has many fantastic restaurants within easy reach and I include recommendations and my favourites in your booking confirmation.
fields.space: Welcome! My apartment is a great place to stay if you want more than a hotel or serviced apartment can offer.  Quality breakfast foods (artisan bread, jams, homemade marmalade, free-range eggs, milk, freshly squeezed juice, cereal, tea, ground coffee etc.) are supplied and I take pride in ensuring everything is spotlessly clean and ready for your stay. My apartment is on the top floor (3rd floor, accessed via a shared spiral staircase - like most Edinburgh buildings there is no lift/elevator) and has dramatic views over the rooftops to Arthur's Seat, the iconic extinct volcano that towers over the city. It is in a traditional Victorian building (built in 1890) in the central, safe and friendly neighbourhood of Abbeyhill. It is off the main road and the street is quiet with very little traffic. There is free parking in the streets outside the apartment which is rare in Edinburgh. Parking is unreserved and free in the street immediately outside the apartment and in the five parallel stre
fields.access: The whole apartment is yours to enjoy and you can come and go as you please. I work in the arts and so can advise you on what's going on locally if you're interested in seeing a performance or visiting the galleries. Maps, tourist leaflets, restaurant guides and info on the immediately local area are available in the flat. There are also books and a library of playscripts for you to enjoy while you stay.

fields.description: Hi! I'm an experienced Airbnb host with great reviews & ratings. Come & stay in my cosy private apartment, only 9 mins walk to Holyrood Palace/Royal Mile and 15 mins walk to Princes St.  Breakfast, linen & fresh towels included plus free on street parking (rare in Edinburgh). Welcome! My apartment is a great place to stay if you want more than a hotel or serviced apartment can offer.  Quality breakfast foods (artisan bread, jams, homemade marmalade, free-range eggs, milk, freshly squeezed juice, cereal, tea, ground coffee etc.) are supplied and I take pride in ensuring everything is spotlessly clean and ready for your stay. My apartment is on the top floor (3rd floor, accessed via a shared spiral staircase - like most Edinburgh buildings there is no lift/elevator) and has dramatic views over the rooftops to Arthur's Seat, the iconic extinct volcano that towers over the city. It is in a traditional Victorian building (built in 1890) in the central, safe and friendly neighbourhood of Abb
fields.host_about: I have lived in Edinburgh since 2000 and have been an Airbnb host since September 2011, I enjoy and take pride in providing a great service in my apartment. I work in arts management and love everything that Edinburgh has to offer so can be really helpful if you're visiting and looking for culture.
fields.name: Top rated, central apt, lovely view + free parking
fields.interaction: I usually leave keys for you to collect from a key safe at the apartment entrance. You can contact me by phone or on airbnb at anytime during your stay. Check-in and check-out times are flexible and I will try and accommodate your schedule whenever possible. It's really helpful to know your travel plans so please let me know what time you intend to arrive and depart and by what method of transport when you book. Sometimes, if someone else is arriving the same day as you leave I will have to ask you to check out at 10am but usually it is 11am.
fields.summary: Hi! I'm an experienced Airbnb host with great reviews & ratings. Come & stay in my cosy private apartment, only 9 mins walk to Holyrood Palace/Royal Mile and 15 mins walk to Princes St.  Breakfast, linen & fresh towels included plus free on street parking (rare in Edinburgh).
fields.house_rules: The apartment is in a quiet neighbourhood in a traditional shared tenement block so please respect the neighbours and you'll have a great time. I try to recycle as much as possible and conserve energy so please help out with this. Sleeping on the sofa is not permitted.

fields.transit: This is a great spot for public transportation! We're next to major bus hubs, the light rail train from the airport and the Amtrak station. If you'll be using a lot of public transportation you might want to buy an Orca Card. You can load it up with however much $ you'd like, and then use it for quicker access when boarding the Light Rail train, buses, etc. Orca kiosks can be found near the ticket & boarding areas at most transportation hubs.
fields.street: South Main Street, Seattle, WA 98104, United States
fields.neighborhood_overview: This is a fun & interesting international neighborhood with lots of quirky shops and tons of food choices. Please check out our online guidebook for lots of recommendations. Please note that we're right next to the Pioneer Square neighborhood, which tends to have a lot of homeless people on the streets. We're used to walking around in this type of city environment, but it isn't for everyone. Though it's generally safer than it might feel, as with most cities we don't recommend walking around by yourself late at night.
fields.space: This is studio #17 - one of two private airbnb rooms (located in the same building). We designed the rooms as simple & affordable spaces for arts-related guests, for brief stays & short-term artist residencies near the heart of Seattle's downtown gallery district. But you don't have to be an artist to stay here - all are welcome!  ** Please read our entire listing description before booking - thx! ** This is a quiet private room located among 15 other art studios on the 2nd floor in the Japantown area of Seattle's historic International District. It has an upper bed-loft with a luxurious Novaform queen mattress & very comfortable bedding - plus a sweet skylight** above the bed. The lower portion of the loft has a small couch (not meant for sleeping), desk & chair, and other basic furniture. Free wifi and satellite TV w/HBO are included. There's a shared kitchenette (not a full kitchen) and 2 shared bathrooms (one with a shower) in the hallway just outside the room. Although there are o

fields.host_about: Hi, we're a married couple living and working in downtown Seattle. We started hosting on airbnb about 3 years ago, and we love it! We currently have 3 listings for you to choose from. The first 2 are single private rooms in an art building near the sports stadiums. Dirk has a contemporary art gallery there and Jaq has her painting studio there, so we're usually around. We also have a 1-bedroom apartment in the center of downtown near the Convention Center and popular attractions like the Pike Place Market. We travel and use airbnb just like you, so we understand what it's like to be a guest. As you can see from our many reviews, we'll do our best to make your stay easy & comfortable. If you have any questions just get in touch!
fields.name: contemporary art loft downtown [17]
fields.notes: Please note that there is a long flight of stairs to get up to our floor and no elevator. Also you need to climb a ladder to get up into the bed loft. And finally just want to make sure you've noticed it is a shared bathroom – not a private bathroom.

fields.name: Beautiful Bedroom Manhattan
fields.notes: Easy to find.
fields.summary: This is a Beautiful Bedroom in Manhattan!
fields.neighborhood_overview: Food and transportation is close.
fields.space: Premium bed. Bed is not soft in the middle and hard on the ends. You will not sink into the bed. Bed is comfortable and expensive. No headboard and footboard so you can easily get out of bed without waking person sleeping next to you. New York is exciting and in this apartment you can meet people from all over the world. I have INSTANT BOOK so there is no need to ask if the place is available. If it is free on the calendar then it is free for booking. Also the price is exactly what comes up when you enter your desired dates. Best deal on Airbnb Manhattan! I live in the apartment and you will live here also.  I have many guests giving me their input and I have everything from rubbing alcohol to band-aids to scissors. Do not go to a hotel where you must purchase all these items at an expensive gift shop. Your room is live in ready. Please let me know if you need me to purchase any items before your stay. Many travel plugs, so your devices will work in the room. Two surge protectors (not

fields.interaction: I will assist guest in travels.

fields.host_about: I want to make your airbnb experience perfect. Travelers need a kitchen with supplies to avoid walking outside to make purchases. Hotels are expensive. Save money and stay with me.
fields.house_rules: How you are arriving so I write directions. Send a message when you are 1 hour away. There is a buzzer on the left of door press buzzer '18'. Or use lockbox on wall before steps combination 0018. We don't have many rules! On your arrival, we will give you a set of keys to the apartment. You are free to come and go as you please; there is no curfew. We will not enter your room while There is no need to strip the bed or do any cleaning before you leave. For longer stays (one week or more), we can replace your towels for you midway through your stay if you like. If you are flying, it is helpful if you give us your airline and flight number before you leave. That way, if your flight is delayed, but you can't call because you are in the air, we can check your flight status online and plan accordingly. Our only real "house rules" are that we don't allow smoking, illegal drug use, or pets. Be nice. We look forward to hosting you!

fields.name: B&B in de Amsterdamse Pijp
fields.notes: I like to mention I only use organic products, like cleaning /washing products and I only offer organic products like shampoo/ shower gel/ coffee and tea you can all use. I can do your laundry on request. My washing machine and dryer are eco quality and I have solar panels on my roof. The two stairs to my room are steep!
fields.summary: Beautiful authentic room with private bathroom for rent in De Pijp.  The room has it's own entrance and is located on the second floor of a very authentic, old house. The street is next to the beautiful Amstel river and the pretty Sarphatipark.
fields.neighborhood_overview: The Pijp is known for it's lively, artistic atmosphere. Around here are many restaurants, cafes, galleries and lively daily market Albert Cuyp. Main attraction is the Heineken manufacturer. This area in more Amsterdam alike than the city center.
fields.space: The Pijp is known for it's lively, artistic atmosphere. Around here are many restaurants, cafes, galleries and lively daily market Albert Cuyp. Main attraction is the Heineken brewery. This area is more Amsterdam alike than the city center. This neighborhood is more working class and locals hangout. The room is very centrally located in between the museum district (which is only a 15 min walk away) and the Amsterdam city center (which is in the other direction 10 min away from here). The city center starts at the Utrechtsestraat, crossing all the canals heading towards Kalverstraat, the biggest shopping street in town. Complete downtown area is doable by foot, or take the tram 4 or 3 which will take you anywhere downtown or train station to transfer for the train to the airport.  I would  be happy helping you out where to go based on your personal interest, or sending you any information about concerts, theater or give you other suggestions which make your stay more convenient. The env
fields.access: Guests will have access to their own private room and private bathroom shower room with toilet. Also provided is a mini fridge, microwave and cutlery. Towels and bedding is included.
fields.interaction: Guests can always ask me anything, anytime. I am always around or easy to reach by phone or email.
fields.transit: Tram number 4 & 3 stops at the end of my street, a 5 min walk away. Tram number 7 &  10 stop a 10 min walk away. The subway stop to Central station and towards Bijlmer Arena ( Ziggodome, Heineken music hall, Ajax Football stage with P+R parking) is about 5 min walk from here.

fields.host_about: I am born and raised in Amsterdam. Next to Amsterdam I've lived in Cincinnati, Ohio (U.S.A) and at the countryside of France at the Dordogne. I used to travel a lot in the U.S.A and love cities like New York, Washington DC and Chicago. Bryce canyon was the most spectacular park I ever visited.  I live alone with my two teenage daughters. For a while I went to the Art Academy. Finally I am working in hospitality for about 20 years. I wrote business plans for my own techno program for a nightclub a saladebar and 100% organic cafetaria. My b&b is an eco friendly one, it means I care about the environment and only offer and use organic products. I like to talk with my guests about Amsterdam or my biggest hobby electronic music.
fields.house_rules: No sanitary towels in my toilet! No smoking in the room.

fields.name: Downtown DC Private Carriage House
fields.notes: Airbnb has notified all Washington DC hosts that, based on an agreement with DC city authorities, as of February 15th, 2015 Airbnb will be required to charge a lodging or hotel tax of 14.5% on the price of all short-term accommodation. This tax is over and above the prices quoted below and will be collected by Airbnb at the time of booking.
fields.summary: Hello! This is an original free standing carriage house built in 1890. The 2nd floor has been fully updated. Hardwood floors, reclaimed bed frame, controllable skylights, Nest Thermostat , mini fridge, microwave, toaster, coffee maker, tea kettle. The 1st floor has a washer/dryer. Please ask questions! Thanks!
fields.neighborhood_overview: Shaw is a hip and up and coming neighborhood that has central access to the sights and sounds of the city!! In the neighborhood there are great restaurants , Dives bars, Beer Gardens and Cocktail Bars.
fields.space: We are one of the original Airbnb hosts in DC.  If the Carriage House isn't available, please check out our other listing at the same location, DC Apartment near White House, Mall - http://www.airbnb.com/rooms/407014  Why share?  You can have your own private house! Why stay in a hotel room? Rent our house - it's wonderful turn-of-the-century, totally private, free-standing Carriage House that has been fully updated.  The sunny 2nd-floor studio apartment features a reclaimed wood, queen sized bed frame with a Casper mattress. A full bathroom stocked with fluffy towels, washcloths,  free body wash, shampoo, and condition. There is an armoire and dresser, couch and coffee table, end tables with lamps. Controllable Velux skylights and blinds , ceiling fan, Nest central heat/AC thermostat, full-size washer and dryer, iron, hair dryer. WiFi, desktop with a flat screen TV hooked up to a PC computer workstation for full streaming  & stereo with Ipod hookup.  We also have a small kitchenette s
fields.access: WIFI, Streaming TV and Movies from the desktop to the flat screen TV. Washer and dryer with free detergent. Free shampoo, conditioner and body wash, blow dryer and flat iron.An incredible location and experience..!!
fields.interaction: This is a totally private apartment. Interaction is minimal
fields.transit: We have a very high walk score (85) The METRO(train system) is half a block away, there are multiple bus stops within 2 blocks of the unit. Zipcars, Cars2Go, Uber are all easily accessed.

We are DC natives and own this property together. We are enjoying hosting all our guests through AirBnB. 

Both of our listings are totally private. We want you to enjoy your stay with us, so please let us know if there is anything else we can do for you.
fields.house_rules: We prefer to use the Airbnb messaging system for all communication so please make sure that you have a valid email address that will send you a notification email when a message gets posted there. Please post your arrival and departure times to the AirBnB message thread as soon as possible. This allows us have a general idea of when you are arriving at the apartment in case of any troubles with check in.  We would like to have our guests do one of the following before staying with us: Link your AirBnB profile to a social network such as (website hidden), (website hidden) or (website hidden); verify your phone number; or complete some more of your AirBnb profile. Thanks! This is a non smoking unit. Anyone smoking in the unit will be left negative feedback.  Please no heavy partying in the Carriage House.

fields.name: Yves Klein -Private Room
fields.notes: To become a better host I recently got my First Aid Certification. Also I guarantee your money back if you don’t like my place upon arrival. No questions asked from my side. And the final thing: I would like to make your stay in my home a good experience for both of us. So I would like to inform you about two thing that are really important to me.  First of all direct communication; if there is anything that you want me to know, ask or something that bothers you, please let me know.  Secondly trust is a key value for me.
fields.summary: ★ Location - The best ★ Room - In a '16th century' apartment ★ Internet connection - Fastest available ★ SuperHost - AirBnB chosen few ★ Not satisfied? - Money back guaranteed! Be Aware: - The stairway is steep - The room might be a little smaller than it appears  - Shared bathroom & toilet
fields.neighborhood_overview: My home is in a 16th century monumental house (2 floors) and is situated in a quieter part of Amsterdam's city center, just a few minutes walk from the lively Dam Square, the canals and all the highlight that this great city has to offer. It is the perfect base for travelers who wish to explore Amsterdam’s nightlife. Many not-to-be-missed historic attractions, museums, and theaters are only a short walk from this listing. Both business and leisure guests will appreciate the room’s proximity to the city's excellent public transport system. I can advise guests regarding bus, train and tram service. Top shopping, bicycle rent shops and canal boats are around the corner.
fields.space: The place and room I am offering is uniquely situated in the historical heart (old city center) of Amsterdam. And fits two people comfortably.  The private room is located on the third floor.
fields.access: Main features of the room: * Fast wifi (My internet plan 200 mb / 20 mb) *Easy access to the room without disturbing anyone when entering and exiting the house *A very comfortable two person bed (180 cm x 200 cm) or two one person bed (90 cm x 200 cm) *Good heather that can be easily adjusted *Towels and sheets are included Interesting fact is that the room is located between the Radisson Blu Hotel (with an average price of 270 euro per night) and Sofitel Legend The Grand Amsterdam (average price of 400 euro per night). Bathroom & Toilet Shared toilet and bathroom on the same floor. The bathroom is spacious with a separate bath and shower.
fields.interaction: I am an experienced host that lives in the same apartment, meaning that I will be there for you whenever needed. If your are searching for a private stay, a stay where you can interact with locals or maybe just get introduced to some of Amsterdam hotspots, then I can be a great host for you.
fields.transit: Tram-stop Spui - 400 m (5 minutes walk) Metro stop Nieuwmarkt - 500 m (6 minutes walk) Central Railway Station – 1.1 km (15 minutes walk) Amsterdam Schiphol Airport - 20 km (30 min cab)
